title: Support Facilities Facility Supervisor
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Support Facilities Facility Supervisor based in our Chino, CA* warehouse.  

The Support Facilities Facility Supervisor reports to the Support Facilities Maintenance Manager, and is responsible for assisting in the management of all maintenance, preventative maintenance, deferred maintenance, and all repairs for the Chino campus. The Support Facilities Facility Supervisor will work closely with other In-N-Out support teams, including Warehousing, Meat and Spread, Fleet Services, Cookout, Security, IT, as well as with 3rd party vendors and contractors. 

*This position is full-time, in-office only. 

General Responsibilities
  • Practice care and maintenance of In-N-Out Burger support facilities in accordance with our established standards of excellence; follow posted work rules and procedures
  • Possess a complete understanding and background in Facilities Maintenance services
  • Participate in the coordination of annual Fire/Life/Safety training; assist in the maintenance of Emergency Operations Center and supplies
  • Ongoing coordination to ensure all compliance regulations and reporting are satisfied
  • Supervise Facility Technicians and coordinate with Janitor team to ensure consistency and best practices through effective teamwork and communication
  • Perform repairs on major systems including BMS, HVAC, High Pressure Water, Waste Water, Machinery, Automation, Robotics, Electrical, and Hydraulics
  • Perform general labor such as carrying, stacking, and sorting of materials used in and around the campus, as well as debris removal
  • Assist in general cleaning of various areas of the campus; includes using a vacuum, mop, brush, broom, floor scrubber, waxer, steam cleaner, high pressure spray cleaner, and various other cleaning devices
  • Prepare and manage Preventative Maintenance Manuals and schedules for the entire campus
  • Assign and supervise drywall patching, tile setting/repair (including ceilings), and mixing materials
  • Perform minor repairs on furniture, floors, vent registers, doors, and door hardware
  • Maintain paint and perform touch-ups on interior and exterior of buildings
  • Perform electrical repairs such as installing/repairing light switches, receptacles, ballasts, power cords, timers, fans, etc.
  • Oversee work with outside contractors for various projects (i.e. HVAC, roll-up doors, elevators, gates, finish carpentry, office equipment installations, etc.)


Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt 
  • Salary Range is $XXX,XXX - $XXX,XXX
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 7:00 am-4:00 pm 
  • Department needs may require occasional overtime 
  • Requires significant field work and travel; will travel around the campus and to hardware stores for parts runs  
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • High School diploma or GED required
  • 4-5 years' experience in general carpentry (required) 
  • 7-10 years' experience in the areas of basic construction, field maintenance, and facility maintenance 
  • Certification through the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) or experience/familiarity to handle refrigerants
  • Certification or Associate's degree from an HVAC program at a vocational/technical school or experience/familiarity with HVAC (required) 
  • Basic electrical certifications or experience/familiarity with electrical (required)
  • OSHA certification (required)
  • Certified to operate a forklift, scissor lift or boom lift 
  • Hands-on construction experience and/or previous handyman experience (required) 
  • Intermediate knowledge of MS Office and proficiency in ServiceNow
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline driven environment, while exhibiting a positive and professional attitude   
  • Prior experience managing a team; strong leadership skills 
  • Strong project management and organizational skills; attention to detail 
  • Able to work on multiple projects simultaneously, be a self-starter, and able to work both autonomously and in a team-oriented atmosphere
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality while exercising discretion and good judgment 
  • Will possess a strong work ethic, excellent organization and communication skills, and the ability to observe safety guidelines   
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 pounds
  • Must possess valid Driver's license 


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: HRIS Systems Analyst III
description_html:
The In-N-Out Burger Human Resources team has an excellent opportunity for a HRIS Systems Analyst, located in the Irvine, CA office*.  The Systems HRIS Analyst’s primary focus is to design develop, test, implement and, administer the human resource information systems (HRIS) systems, with a primary focus on Oracle Cloud HCM. This position serves as a technical point of contact and oversees user acceptance testing of system changes, analyzing process flows for process improvement opportunities and optimizing HR systems. This person will collaborate with the HR functional team to define requirements and lead the system configuration, testing, troubleshooting, and maintenance of Oracle HCM modules. 

The HRIS Systems Analyst also participates in HRIS upgrades, patches, fixes, testing and other technical projects as assigned. This position will be responsible for providing level 2 support to Associates across In-N-Out, in technical matters related to HRIS. They will develop user training materials and maintain documentation for their work.

*This role is based full time in office

General Responsibilities
  • Perform system maintenance and application upgrades, including keeping up with Oracle’s periodic updates, assisting in the review, testing and implementation of Oracle Cloud HCM system (Core HR, Benefits, Compensation, Absence, Talent Management, HR Help Desk, HCM Analytics). Collaborate with functional and technical staff to coordinate application upgrade/fix. Maintain HRIS system tables. Document process and results. Configure, develop and independently manage Oracle Cloud HCM modules.
  • Collaborate with HR functional experts and other departments to understand functional needs and define requirements.
  • Provides production support, including researching and resolving technical and functional issues, unexpected results or process flaws; performing scheduled activities; recommending solutions or alternate methods to meet requirements.
  • Optimize HRIS processes by integrating the software/systems to build a highly integrated and automated set of processes.
  • Perform audits on HR processes, documents and data. Take action that is consistent with available facts, constraints and consequences.  
  • Maintain specialization in the specific areas of responsibilities through constant learning the new technologies and best industry practices.
  • Maintains awareness of technological advancements and current trends in HRIS. Continuously increase both HR and HRIS application/tools knowledge.
  • Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions, to be approved by appropriate leadership prior to implementation.
  • Conduct training; Develop user procedures, guidelines, and training.
  • Create and maintain master structural data in the system (i.e., Dept./Org tree, Job code, location etc.) 

Work Schedule and Benefits
  • Full-time position, Exempt
  • Onsite, in office hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Department needs will call for occasional overtime
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) Plan
  • Salary Pay Range $106,000 - $133,000 *Represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent 
  • 2-5 years of experience in Core HR and multiple of the following modules within Oracle Cloud HCM: Benefits, Compensation, Talent Management, Help Desk, Absence preferred
  • 3-7 years of proven work experience as HRIS analyst or similar role
  • Expertise in writing complex SQLs preferred
  • Experience in writing Fast Formula preferred
  • Understanding of quantitative/qualitative measurement and data/system design principles
  • Excellent Verbal and Written communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate, provide technical support and train staff. Proven experience in documenting processes, running diagnostic tests and audits
  • Excellent organization skills and attention to details
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with a programming language and PL/SQL preferred
  • Excellent Time Management Skills
  • Ability to work independently under a general guidance
  • Experience with a Project Management Tool or certifications as HRIS analyst preferred

title: Butcher
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a Full-Time Butcher in our Lancaster, TX Meat Department.   

General Responsibilities:

  • De-boning arm chucks, removing excess fat, gristle and bone to comply with In-N-Out standards. 
  • Observes for any imperfections; such as, bruises and foreign matter and reports any findings. 
  • Final inspection of all products before it is sent for processing 
  • Clean and maintain tools and equipment 

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time, Non-Exempt 
  • Pay Range: $24.00 to $28.00/hourly + Monthly Butcher Incentive
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • This position is also eligible to earn a Butcher Incentive based on production levels
  • Rotating Schedule, 5am-1:30pm, Holiday and Weekend availability required, overtime as needed 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance


Job Requirements:

  • Have a minimum of 3-5 years of experience as a Butcher in a meat processing facility
  • Be able to demonstrate fast pace de-boning skills on chuck 
  • Performing all duties with pride and craftsmanship and to work well in an atmosphere of teamwork and cooperation while adhering to all safety and sanitation standards
  • High school diploma or GED


Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Must be able to demonstrate fast pace de-boning skills
  • Ability to move freely in and around obstacles common in the meat production room and the ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs 
  • Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Driver I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Delivery Driver in our Draper, UT warehouse. The Delivery Driver will be based out of our Draper warehouse, and will be responsible for the delivery and rotation of product to our In-N-Out Burger restaurant locations and satellite warehouses. 

About Our Fleet:

  • 389 Peterbilt Classic Day Cabs
  • Quiet Reefer (Carrier brand)
  • 13-speed transmission/Eaton
  • Great Dane trailer with lift gates and electric pallet jack (no ramps)
General Responsibilities

  • Operate company truck to provide daily deliveries to In-N-Out Burger restaurants located in northern California
  • Be responsible for the delivery and rotation of product
  • Ensure that our customers receive only the freshest, highest quality ingredients
  • Operate an electric pallet jack, forklift, lift gates, hand trucks
  • Move large product racks
  • Establish and maintain excellent customer service relationships
  • Complete some warehouse duties such as loading/unloading trucks, and order pulling for the store deliveries
  • Perform all duties with pride; Work well in an atmosphere of teamwork and cooperation
Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Hours: 12am – 10:30 am 
  • Four (4) nights per week; Rotating Schedule
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) Plan
  • Free meals on work days 
  • Pay: $39.00 per hour (Starting)

Job Requirements:

  • High school diploma or GED (required)
  • A minimum of two (2) years experience as a CDL holder delivery driver (required)
  • Experience with direct store or restaurant delivery experience (preferred)
  • Must be comfortable working and driving in inclement weather
  • Ability to lift 60-75 lbs. on a continuous basis
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management
  • Strong initiative; Ability to work independently and follow through safely and accurately on assignments with minimal supervision
  • Valid Class A driver’s license (required) with a clean driving record
  • Must be able pass a company administered driving test and be able to properly operate a 10-speed and 13-speed transmission
  • Must be able to drive a manual transmission
 

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Project Carpenter Intermediate
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time intermediate Project Carpenter/Tile Setter based in the Orange County, CA. The Project Carpenter will cover the In-N-Out Burger stores throughout California.  The Carpenter will be responsible for the maintenance and construction of all In-N-Out Burger facilities and restaurants in the area of carpentry and tile setting.  

General Responsibilities

The Service Carpenter Intermediate oversees all carpentry needs and improvements in their assigned area based on

work orders and general direction. This includes store updates and repairs to tile, drywall, stucco and cement, and

roofing. This individual also conducts audits to identify and complete preventive maintenance. Requires being

proficient in rough and finish carpentry, plumbing and concrete. This position also oversees contractors and assists

technicians as needed. Must also ensure maintenance of the company vehicle. This requires strong verbal and

written communication and organizational skills, leadership, detail oriented, accuracy, mathematical skills,

experience in the use of power and hand tools, and ability to work independently and as a team. Two to five years

of construction/carpentry knowledge is required.

Work Schedule + Benefits 
Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
Company provided tools 
Growth and development opportunities through continuous on-the-job training 
* Pay Range is $27.75-$31.75 per hour (Beginner)
* Pay Range is $36.00-$41.50 per hour (Intermediate)                     

The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
Schedule: 7 days on/7 days off; rotating days
Hours: Graveyard shift: 12:00 a.m. to 10:30 a.m.; overtime as needed
Travel: 40-50% of time, work will be spent out of town 

Company truck will be assigned (Must live within 45 miles of Baldwin Park Warehouse)
Weekend and holiday availability required

Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance


Travel Schedule
Extensive travel is required - Carpenters work on all In-N-Out restaurants throughout the state of California, and sometimes out of state
Will require out-of-town travel for 1-2 weeks at a time, every month or every other month
Travel will require out of town hotel stays for 1 week, or more, at a time


Qualifications
2-5+ years experience in Carpentry, Construction, or related fields 
2-4+ years experience in Tile setting; Tile contractor experience a plus 
Extensive out of town and overnight travel: Ability to travel and be out of town for 1 week or more, at least every month or every other month
Strong customer service orientation  
Self-starter, independent worker, Pride and ownership of work
Strong attention to detail and good time management
Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.
High School diploma or equivalent
A Valid California Driver's License with a clean driving record
Strong verbal and written English language communication skills



ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Construction Coordinator I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Construction Coordinator I based in our Baldwin Park, CA* Store Development office, in the New Construction Department.  The Construction Coordinator will perform administrative and clerical duties such filing, typing, scanning, and copying documents for the real estate and new construction teams.  This person will report to the Construction Operations Supervisor. 

The New Construction department is responsible for the building and development of In-N-Out Burger restaurants.  This team works closely with Real Estate, Development, and other Construction teams.

*This position is full-time, in-office only.


General Responsibilities
  • Perform clerical duties for the Store Development and New Construction offices 
  • Screen and transfer phone calls, answer emails, arrange meetings and accommodations; maintain and order office supplies
  • Assist the Construction Coordinator II in opening and sorting daily mail
  • Handle and book travel for the new construction associates, process construction invoices, provide office and technical support to the superintendents and technicians
  • Maintain files for each of the on-going construction projects; keep them updated
  • Keep track of preliminary notices, waivers, and releases
  • Special projects will be assigned as needed
  • Will work with construction and development teams to build In-N-Out Burger restaurants  

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Non-Exempt 
  • Pay Range is $28.25-$31.25 per hour
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Work Hours: Monday-Friday, 7:00 am-4:00 pm
  • Office location: Baldwin Park, CA
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • 3-5 years' experience working as an Office clerk, Office Administrator or Coordinator, or as an Accounting clerk
  • Preferable experience working in Construction and/or Real Estate development offices 
  • 3-5 years of accounting background, preferably in Construction Accounting
  • 2-3  years' experience in administrative support for the construction of fast food restaurants
  • Must have intermediate word processing, spreadsheet and software skills
  • Strong proficiency in MS Office Suite programs and Construction Management software 
  • Knowledge of local quality, safety, and health guidelines for construction job sites


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Lab Technician
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

In-N-Out Burger, a family and growth-oriented restaurant company, has an excellent opportunity for a full-time Laboratory Technician in our Chino, CA food testing laboratory.  The primary focus of this facility is beef, environmental, dairy, and pourable liquid testing. This position is responsible for conducting sample analysis, results interpretation, verifying instrumentation calibration and implementing good laboratory practices.


General Responsibilities:

  • Performing qualitative (PCR), quantitative (indicator organism), and basic food Chemistry testing, as well as assembling, analyzing, reviewing and reporting data utilizing a Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS)
  • Continuing one’s professional development in Microbiology, Food Chemistry, basic Statistics, ISO 17025 and other core technical competencies
  • Preparing and maintaining stock media solutions
  • Utilizing aseptic technique to prepare samples for enrichment
  • Understanding and implementing GMP, GLP, FDA-BAM and USDA-MLG procedures
  • Creating reports using basic data table and graphing techniques
  • Ensuring that all laboratory tests are conducted, entered and reported according to laboratory protocols
  • Conducting routine food, environmental and/or process improvement sampling
  • Contributing to special projects through root cause analysis and continuous improvement techniques
  • Periodically reviewing and auditing laboratory results and reporting
  • Maintaining instrumentation in good working order through periodic inspections and calibrations
  • Participating in check sample and other internal verification programs
  • Following laboratory quality assurance, occupational safety and sanitation programs
  • Assisting the Laboratory Supervisor when absent to fulfill departmental needs
  • Perform all technician duties with pride and craftsmanship while fostering a culture of teamwork, cooperation, occupational safety and dedication to helping others succeed


Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Non-Exempt Hourly
  • Pay Range: $28.80-$32.00 per hour 
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors. 
  • Lab/Warehouse location: Chino, CA
  • Schedule: Thursday-Monday (days off: Tuesday, Wednesday) 
  • Shifts can start between 5:00am and 11:00am; 5 days per week, 8-hour shifts
  • Weekend and holiday availability required; some overtime as needed 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance


Qualifications for INO associates:

  • In-N-Out Burger Store or Support experience: Minimum 2 years tenure with In-N-Out Burger 
  • Degree in Science, Microbiology or Food Science preferred
  • Some Laboratory experience or internship in similar preferred 


Additional Qualifications:

  • Bachelors of Science degree in Microbiology, Food Science, Animal Science, Meat Science preferred 
  • A minimum of 1 year of experience in a Microbiology laboratory, preferably with food based PCR and indicator organism analyses along with basic Food Chemistry testing
  • Experience within an ISO 17025 accredited laboratory
  • Strong written, verbal, problem solving and critical thinking skills
  • A working knowledge of GLP, GMP, FDA-BAM and USDA-MLG methodologies
  • Familiarity of basic HACCP and Process Controls for Human Food principles
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft office software, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Accountant - Family Office
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  


The In-N-Out Burger Family Office (Finance & Investments) department has an excellent opportunity for a full-time Accountant based in the Irvine, CA* office.  This position involves managing multi-entity accounting, trust administration support, tax coordination, and high-level financial reporting.  The Family Office Accountant will report to the Investment Operations Supervisor and is responsible for providing support for all accounting related functions pertaining to the Family Office.

*This position is full-time, in-office only


General Responsibilities
• Manage bookkeeping and accounting across multiple entities and trusts
• Maintain general ledgers, prepare financial statements, and track entity performance
• Administration and Point of contact for all Payroll needs for the Family Office
• Perform year over year and monthly variance analysis for consolidated financial statements by working cross functionally to understand variances and ensure accuracy of financials.
• Review month-end account reconciliations and reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing account information
• Review monthly reporting designed to assist operations and departments with understanding specific results
• Responsible for preparing monthly journal entries and account reconciliations to support an accurate and timely financial close
• Prepare documentation and support for annual tax filings for all entities and trusts. This includes partnership and communication with tax partners
• Ensure all legal and tax obligations are met in a timely and organized manner
• Monitor and maintain records for investment activity, asset holdings, and distributions
• This position requires effective communication, confidentiality, and decision making


Work Schedule + Benefits
• Full-time position, Exempt 
• Pay Range is $83,700 - $110,000 annual
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors. 
• Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
• Department needs may call for occasional overtime   
• Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance



Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
• Additional certification (CPA or Master's) is preferred
• Minimum of 2-5+ years of Accounting and Tax experience, including trust or multi-entity accounting
• Deep understanding of entity structures, tax reporting requirements, and GAAP
• Familiarity with estate planning and trust accounting standards
• Experience coordinating with legal and tax professionals
• Exposure to real estate investments, private equity, or passive income entities  
• Strong skills in QuickBooks, Excel, and other financial software
• Discretion, integrity, and the ability to handle confidential information with professionalism
• Strong moral compass: ability to operate with integrity and professionalism when handling sensitive and confidential information




Work Location Details 

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948. 

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance, or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.






ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.
description_text:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!
The In-N-Out Burger
Family Office
(Finance & Investments) department has an excellent opportunity for a full-time
Accountant
based in the
Irvine, CA*
office.  This position involves managing multi-entity accounting, trust administration support, tax coordination, and high-level financial reporting.  The Family Office Accountant will report to the Investment Operations Supervisor and is responsible for providing support for all accounting related functions pertaining to the Family Office.
*This position is full-time, in-office only
General Responsibilities
•
Manage bookkeeping and accounting across multiple entities and trusts
•
Maintain general ledgers, prepare financial statements, and track entity performance
•
Administration and Point of contact for all Payroll needs for the Family Office
•
Perform year over year and monthly variance analysis for consolidated financial statements by working cross functionally to understand variances and ensure accuracy of financials.
•
Review month-end account reconciliations and reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing account information
•
Review monthly reporting designed to assist operations and departments with understanding specific results
•
Responsible for preparing monthly journal entries and account reconciliations to support an accurate and timely financial close
•
Prepare documentation and support for annual tax filings for all entities and trusts. This includes partnership and communication with tax partners
•
Ensure all legal and tax obligations are met in a timely and organized manner
•
Monitor and maintain records for investment activity, asset holdings, and distributions
•
This position requires effective communication, confidentiality, and decision making
Work Schedule + Benefits
•
Full-time position, Exempt
•
Pay Range is $83,700 - $110,000 annual
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.
•
Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
•
Department needs may call for occasional overtime
•
Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
Qualifications
•
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
•
Additional certification (CPA or Master's) is preferred
•
Minimum of 2-5+ years of Accounting and Tax experience, including trust or multi-entity accounting
•
Deep understanding of entity structures, tax reporting requirements, and GAAP
•
Familiarity with estate planning and trust accounting standards
•
Experience coordinating with legal and tax professionals
•
Exposure to real estate investments, private equity, or passive income entities
•
Strong skills in QuickBooks, Excel, and other financial software
•
Discretion, integrity, and the ability to handle confidential information with professionalism
•
Strong moral compass: ability to operate with integrity and professionalism when handling sensitive and confidential information
Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.
Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance, or work from our western headquarters in
Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029
. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout
California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho
. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

title: Sanitation Technician I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Sanitation Technician in our Lancaster, TX Meat Processing Facility.  The Sanitation Technician will  earn an hourly wage of  $22.00 - $24.50/HR plus benefits depending on experience.

General Responsibilities:

  • Be directly responsible for maintaining the sanitation of the commissary plant equipment
  • Use all proper cleaning procedures so that it meets with both In-N-Out Burger and USDA standards
  • Clean and sanitize food processing equipment
  • Assist in reassembling equipment when necessary
  • Monitor and document chemical concentrations to ensure proper cleaning of equipment
  • Follow all safety policies and procedures at all times

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Pay Range: $22.00 to $24.50/hourly DOE
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Shift Hours: 2:00 p.m. to 10:30 p.m (Monday thru Thursday)
  • Shift Hours: 12 p.m. to 8:30 p.m (Friday- Sunday)
  • 2 Days off per week/ Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Job Requirements:

  •  High school diploma or GED
  • One (1) year experience working in a meat facility or similar responsibilities preferred but not required
  • Sanitation experience in a food processing plant  preferred but not required
  • Ability to read chemical labels and follow safe handling procedures for  all chemicals used in cleaning activities

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.
  • Ability to climb ladders and not be afraid of heights
  • Ability to withstand varied environmental conditions, such as cold and heat, extreme wet, within closed surroundings
  • Will work in cold, damp environments; will work in warm, damp environments
  • Production rooms are warm when cleaning them: 70-80 degrees
  • Will wear rain gear while hosing down equipment
  • Occasional work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit
  • Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling
  • Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Sr. Financial Analyst
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a Senior Financial Analyst to join our Support Finance Team, located in the Chino, CA office*, specializing in Supply Chain and Maintenance operations. This position will report to the Financial Planning & Analysis Supervisor and will be responsible for the budgeting process, developing workforce planning models, variance analysis and capacity planning.  This position will also serve as a key finance partner to our Supply Chain and Maintenance leaders, providing financial insights and strategic support to help informed decision-making.
*Please note that this is a full-time in-office position.

General Responsibilities
  • Facilitates the budgeting, and forecasting processes, ensuring accuracy, alignment with organizational objectives, and timely performance reviews that drive business accountability.
  • Build, analyze and maintain labor models based on key performance indicators (KPIs), and productivity metrics to support workforce planning.
  • Develop, maintain, and apply advanced financial/scenario models to support long-term planning, business initiatives, and performance forecasting 
  • Partner with leaders to assess capacity needs, analyze volume trends, and plan for future growth, ensuring financial strategies align with evolving business demands.
  • Support period-end deliverables such as variance analysis and commodity reporting
  • Prepare and deliver high-impact financial reports and strategic presentations to leadership, providing actionable insights and clear recommendations.
  • Leverage data tools and technologies (e.g., Excel, Oracle, Tableau, Power BI, SQL) to gather, analyze, and interpret large datasets, ensuring precise, timely, and strategic analysis.
  • Continuously improve financial processes and reporting systems, implementing best practices and innovative solutions that enhance accuracy, efficiency, and insight generation.

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt 
  • Salary Range is $107,000 - $126,000
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Onsite, in office hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm 
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime.
  • This position will be based out of our Chino, CA office. Requires occasional travel for off-site meetings at our Irvine, CA and Baldwin Park, CA offices, depending on business needs.
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance.


Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Supply Chain, or a related field.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in finance with a strong background in financial modeling, workforce planning and reporting
  • Preferred experience with food production, warehouse, logistics/delivery, or technical field services industry.
  • Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly convey complex financial insights to cross-functional teams and leadership.
  • Advanced Excel skills; proficiency with financial systems such as Oracle and Smartview.


About In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Senior Mobility Partner
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

The In-N-Out Burger Benefits team has an excellent opportunity for a Sr. Mobility Partner based out of our Irvine, CA* office. 

The Sr. Mobility Partner reports to the Mobility Supervisor and plays a key role in delivering a seamless, high-touch relocation experience that reflects our values and deep commitment to supporting Associates during life-changing transitions. This role is responsible for overseeing the end-to-end relocation process while ensuring an exceptional level of care, service, and professionalism. Key responsibilities include coordinating with internal stakeholders and third-party vendors, serving as a trusted point of contact for Associates and managers, managing relocation policy application, cost monitoring, vendor performance, and reporting. This individual will also handle escalations, provide guidance on complex or sensitive cases, contribute to process improvements, and ensure compliance with internal policies and external regulations. The ideal candidate will have 7–10 years of relevant mobility or HR experience, strong project management and communication skills, and a genuine passion for delivering a world-class associate experience.  
*This position is full-time, in-office only

General Responsibilities
  • Coordinating with internal stakeholders, the relocation management company, and third-party vendors, serving as a trusted first point of contact for Associates, Managers and New Hires (and their families) during relocation, assignment and transfer process. 
  • Deliver personalized, high-touch support to ensure smooth, stress-free transition marked by exceptional care and communication. Address concerns and provide guidance with empathy and efficiency. 
  • Manage sensitive or complex relocations. Handle escalations, provide guidance on complex or sensitive cases.
  • Manage end-to-end relocation activities, including policy interpretation, cost estimations, move logistics, and destination services, ensuring alignment with company standards and an exceptional associate experience. 
  • Contribute to the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of mobility policies and programs, ensuring they align with business goals, adapt to workforce needs, and comply with all relevant regulations.
  • Monitor and manage vendor performance and service-level agreements to ensure high-quality delivery and accountability. Maintain accurate records and reports while ensuring data integrity across mobility systems and processes.
  • Collaborate with Talent Acquisition, HR Business Partners, Legal, Tax, Payroll and external relocation vendors to ensure the seamless execution of mobility processes. 
  • Manage relocation policy application, cost monitoring, vendor performance, and reporting. 
  • Contribute to process improvements and ensure compliance with internal policies and external regulations. 
  • Collect, analyze, and organize data, information, and resources to support mobility initiatives, reporting, and cross-functional projects.
  • Ensure all relocation activities are compliant with company policies, legal requirements, and industry standards. Stay current on relevant laws, regulations, and trends within the relocation and mobility space to proactively mitigate risk and maintain best practices.


Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt
  • Pay Range: $93,000-$116,000. The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Department needs will call for occasional evenings and weekends
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • 7–10 years of relevant experience in Relocation/Mobility Industry Services or Relocation Department within Human Resources
  • Strong project management and communication skills, and a genuine passion for delivering a world-class associate experience.  
  • Curiosity and passion for the field of relocation / mobility.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Excellent organization skills and attention to details.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent project and time management skills. Project Management tool experience desired.
  • Proficient with MS Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint.


Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its West Coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

About In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas and Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order food prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

title: Associate Real Estate Counsel
description_html:
Come join the Real Estate family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Associate Real Estate Counsel based in our Baldwin Park, CA* office.  The Associate Real Estate Counsel provides professional legal support to the real estate department of In-N-Out Burger, and reports directly to the Department Head.  

*This position is full-time, in-office only

General Responsibilities
  • Provide legal support for the Real Estate and Property Management department 
  • Address landlord/tenant and other operational issues and property management matters
  • Conduct all aspects of transactional legal negotiations for new store development, existing store remodels, and related real property due diligence (including title and survey review and advising on land use matters)
  • Communicate with other real estate department team members regarding contractual status, key dates/deadlines, requirements, action steps and costs

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt
  • Salary Range is $190,000 - $230,000
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors. 
  • Office Hours:  Monday-Friday, 8:00 am - 5:00 pm
  • Office location: Baldwin Park Real Estate Office 
  • Some need for weekend or after hours work; occasional overnight travel may be required 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • Juris Doctorate Degree  from an ABA-accredited law school; required  
  • Licensed attorney in good standing with the California Bar Association; required 
  • Minimum 4+ years’ experience practicing real estate law, with an emphasis on quick service restaurant/retail development desired
  • Expertise in real estate property contract negotiations and due diligence
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including public speaking/presentation skills 
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and to exercise discretion and good judgment; strong moral compass and ability to operate with integrity and professionalism 
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent time management skills and proven ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment 
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work autonomously and independently, yet be an integral part of an overall team environment
  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office software, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook 


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

Some need for weekend or after hours work; occasional overnight travel may be required
Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
Qualifications
Juris Doctorate Degree  from an ABA-accredited law school; required
Licensed attorney in good standing with the California Bar Association; required
Minimum 4+ years’ experience practicing real estate law, with an emphasis on quick service restaurant/retail development desired
Expertise in real estate property contract negotiations and due diligence
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including public speaking/presentation skills
Ability to maintain confidentiality and to exercise discretion and good judgment; strong moral compass and ability to operate with integrity and professionalism
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Excellent time management skills and proven ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work autonomously and independently, yet be an integral part of an overall team environment
Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office software, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

title: FSQA Technical Services Manager - Beef Category
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Corporate Technical Services Manager for Beef Manufacturing based in our Chino, CA food processing center. For qualified highly candidates, an alternate work location in Lancaster, Texas or Lathrop, California may also be considered. 

This person reports to the FSQA Department Head, serves as a subject matter expert, and has responsibility in all areas of FSQA for beef manufacturing throughout the company. This includes food safety, quality assurance, laboratory operations, regulatory affairs, sanitation, and research and development activities across three production facilities.  This individual is responsible for associated budgets, Associate development, and related program regulatory compliance.  This role also serves to benchmark vendor performance and evaluate process controls to identify means of continuous improvement. Skills required for this position include analytical and deductive reasoning, critical thinking, problem solving, team-oriented leadership, and excellent verbal and written communications.

General Responsibilities:

  • Monitor food safety and regulatory compliance of beef manufacturing 
  • Oversight of FSQA related programs and vendor feedback on incoming raw materials
  • Research and development of new packaging, products, equipment, and software related to food safety
  • Visit suppliers’ facilities/sites regularly to inspect and review processes, procedures, and quality standards, and report and review findings
  • Maintain and keep current on food safety regulations, processes, and best practices and ensure compliance in the company’s processes and procedures
  • Provide complete and timely communication to the FSQA Department Head and the Director of Meat Operations on any items that may impact the management of the overall meat operations group 
  • Analyze and evaluate process controls to identify opportunities for continuous improvement
  • Perform other job-related duties as required


Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, (Exempt)
  • Pay Range $115,000 - $150,000
  • Eligible for a 15% Quarterly Bonus 
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Monday-Friday, typically 7AM-4PM, flexibility required
  • Weekends and nights as needed 
  • Travel between production sites on a monthly basis (20%-50% Travel)
  • Excellent Benefits, including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
 
Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years experience in meat operations or beef-focused facility
  • HACCP certification
  • Knowledge of USDA-FSIS, and regulatory affairs is required
  • A working knowledge of beef regulatory affairs and beef specific food safety principles and best practices.  
  • A master’s degree or higher level education in animal science, microbiology, food science, statistics, sanitary equipment and facility design, or other closely related field is highly desirable. Extensive beef specific experience may substitute for some education.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications 
  • Proven relationship building and leadership experience in a team setting  
  • Strong time management and prioritization 
  • Strong computer skills, including trending and statistical analysis
  • Demonstrated analytical, critical thinking, deductive reasoning, and problem-solving  
  • A valid drivers license and ability to fly commercially are required

Physical Demands/Requirement:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 pounds
  • Occasionally exposed to working in high, precarious places; tight, constricted areas; outdoor weather conditions; fumes or airborne particles.  
  • Position requires frequent lifting, walking, reaching, standing, climbing, stooping, bending, kneeling, working near moving mechanical parts
  • Cold working conditions: Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 36 degrees Fahrenheit 
  • Frequently exposed to wet humid conditions (non-weather)

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Janitor I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a Full-time Janitor based at the Phoenix, AZ Warehouse


The Janitor will be responsible for taking care of the Phoenix buildings and maintaining the overall cleanliness and appearance of the In-N-Out Burger facility and warehouse.  This includes cleaning and maintaining the offices, lunchrooms, restrooms, and exterior of the warehouse building and corporate offices.  


General Responsibilities

  • Clean designated building areas, by dusting, sweeping, vacuuming, mopping, restroom cleaning, etc.
  • Collect and dispose of trash.
  • Stock and maintain supply rooms and cleaning equipment.
  • Assist with the set-up of events within the warehouse and corporate offices.
  • Document routine inspection and maintenance activities.
  • Carry out heavy cleansing tasks and special projects.
  • Notify management of deficiencies or needs for repairs; Adjust and minor repairs.
  • Cooperate with the warehouse staff; carry out duties in a friendly manner.
  • Follow all health and safety regulations.

Work Schedule 

·    Full Time: Wednesday-Sunday: 3:30pm-12:00am (Off Mondays And Tuesdays)


Pay Range + Benefits

  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Warehouse location: Phoenix
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime.
  • May have to cover other shifts on occasion.
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications for INO associates

  • A valid Arizona drivers license is required 
  • In-N-Out Burger Store experience: Must have worked in the Stores 1-2+ years; and/or:
  • In-N-Out Burger Support experience: Must have worked in Support 1-2+ years
  • Cleanup store experience preferred

Additional Qualifications

  • A valid AZ drivers license is required
  • Minimum 2+ years proven work experience as a Janitor, Custodian, or in Sanitation preferred 
  • Janitor or Sanitation experience at a warehouse facility or distribution center would be a plus
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.; Ability to handle heavy equipment and machinery
  • Knowledge of cleaning chemicals and supplies
  • Strong interpersonal skills; friendly and professional 
  • Ability to interact with all levels of management and outside organizations to represent the company in a positive manner
  • Self-starter and ability to work autonomously and independently; Integrity 
  • Pride in your work and a desire for cleanliness and organization
  • High school degree or GED

About In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Warehouse Worker
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Warehouse Associate in our Lancaster, TX warehouse. 

This position can potentially lead to training and development to obtain a CDL and transition to a Delivery Driver for our restaurants located in Texas (Austin, Dallas, San Antonio, and Houston regions).  

General Responsibilities
  • Order pulling on a routine basis:  Moving food items from storage areas to the shipping pallet
  • Physically pull orders from shelves and load them onto forklifts
  • Transport packed items onto the shipping pallet; assist in loading onto the delivery truck
  • Receiving and entering all paperwork into the computer, such as invoices, production sheets and inter-store
  • Reviewing daily delivery reports and report any discrepancies
  • Making special deliveries to the In-N-Out stores using a company vehicle, van or refrigerated Bobtail truck
Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Hourly, Benefits
  • Rotating schedule, hours are: 11:00am - 9:30pm
  • Department needs may require working an adjusted schedule and / or overtime hours
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Free meals on workdays 
Job Requirements:
  • High school diploma or GED (required)
  • A minimum of one (1) year experience as an Order Puller
  • Ability to lift 60-75 lbs. on a continuous basis
  • Demonstrated ability to perform at a high degree of accuracy and thoroughness
  • Computer proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook; proficiency in PowerPoint a plus
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management and outside organizations
  • Represent the company in a positive and professional manner
  • Valid non-commercial Texas driver’s license (required)

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

title: Fuel Tender-Truck Washer
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Truck Washer currently based in our Chino, CA facility.  The Truck Washer is responsible for fueling, washing, and overall cleanliness, both interior and exterior of the company’s diverse fleet. A key part of this role also involves maintaining In-N-Out’s core values and Mission Purpose Statement in helping to keep the facility, wash bays, and fueling stations clean, organized, and safe.

General Responsibilities

  • Operate high-pressure water hoses to clean and sanitize trailer interiors, ensuring all wash standards are met.
  • Fuel tractors, trailers, and other company vehicles, ensuring each unit is clean, safe, and ready for operation.
  • Perform detailed washing and interior cleaning of various fleet vehicles, including delivery units, cookout trucks, and support vehicles.
  • Conduct steam cleaning of delivery trailers and engine compartments and assist with the upkeep of wash and fuel island equipment.
  • Maintain and safely operate all cleaning equipment including pressure washers, vacuums, fuel pumps, and personal protective equipment.
  • Maneuver CMVs on company property and in/out of wash and shop bays as needed.
  • Assist with basic maintenance tasks, such as repairing hoses and hose reels, and help other departments with equipment pick-ups or shop custodial tasks.
  • Communicate regularly with fleet, warehouse, and other teams regarding vehicle assignments and readiness.
  • Complete vehicle inspection reports and cleaning logs clearly and accurately using company tablets or forms.
  • Report mechanical defects or issues immediately to the appropriate personnel.
  • Follow supervisor instructions and safety protocols with attention to detail.
  • Support associates with tasks like uncoupling/coupling tractors and organizing equipment.
  • Perform thorough post-trip inspections including lights, tires, fluids, belts, and telematics systems to ensure vehicle readiness.
  • Follow all regulations and protocols during cleaning and fueling operations.
  • Demonstrate initiative in learning basic mechanical repairs such as lights, mudflaps, and minor equipment fixes.
  • Adhere to all safety rules and wear proper personal protective equipment (PPE) at all times.
  • Work safely and effectively in outdoor conditions, around loud noise, heavy machinery, and moving vehicles.

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Hours: 6:00am – 2:30pm, Tuesday - Saturday
  • Weekend and holiday availability required; Overtime as necessary
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Free meals on workdays
  • Pay Range is $23.00-$25.00 per hour
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors

Job Requirements

  • High school diploma or GED
  • Valid California Driver's License
  • Forklift certified (preferred)
  • Basic knowledge of MS Office
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills
  • Dependable and reliable; excellent time management skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management
  • Ability to lift 50lbs.
  • Ability to work with heavy machinery
  • Experience using an electric riding pallet jack and hand-truck (preferred)

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.
In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Heavy Duty Diesel Mechanic - Experienced
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Heavy Duty Diesel Mechanic (Experienced level) currently based in our Chino, CA facility. The Heavy Duty Diesel Mechanic is responsible for performing preventative maintenance and repairs on all In-N-Out Burger equipment, ensuring optimal functionality, safety, and reliability across the fleet.

General Responsibilities

  • Perform routine preventative maintenance on company vehicles, heavy-duty equipment, including tractors, trailers, lift gates, reefer units, and generators, ensuring strict adherence to manufacturer guidelines and Department of Transportation (DOT) regulations.
  • Execute preventive maintenance tasks such as oil changes, tire checks, fluid checks, filter replacements, and other essential preventive measures to maintain the fleet’s optimal performance and minimize downtime.
  • Demonstrate proficiency in diagnosing, repairing, and replacing minor components such as lights, mudflaps, mirrors, air lines, batteries, belts, and various cab components.
  • Effectively diagnose and repair medium and major components, including powertrain systems, suspension systems, wheel-end components, and engine systems, ensuring efficient vehicle performance.
  • Troubleshoot and repair complex systems such as aftertreatment, HVAC, hydraulic systems, and reefer units, ensuring that all systems operate reliably and efficiently.
  • Conduct thorough post-repair safety checks to ensure that all repaired vehicles meet the required safety standards and regulatory requirements.
  • Accurately maintain records of vehicle maintenance, repairs, parts usage, and services performed in electronic databases or maintenance software, ensuring compliance with company policies and industry standards.
  • Keep up with the latest technological advancements and industry trends, actively sharing knowledge with associates to enhance skills and improve operational efficiency.
  • Collaborate with supervisors and associates to ensure the timely availability of parts and tools, ensuring uninterrupted maintenance and repair operations.
  • Work effectively with other associates to troubleshoot and resolve complex mechanical or electrical issues, providing expertise and working collaboratively to achieve optimal results.
  • Guide and mentor less experienced associates, providing leadership and support for their professional development and technical proficiency.
  • Respond to roadside calls and replace tires, providing tire repair services and minor repairs in a safe, timely, and efficient manner to minimize operational downtime.
  • Procure necessary parts and tools for repairs through established processes, ensuring purchases are in compliance with IN-N-Out procedures and accounting practices.
  • Maintain precise records of parts usage, ensuring inventory levels are monitored and managed accurately to avoid delays or shortages that could affect repair timelines.

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time- Hourly
  • The hours for this position: Sun-Thursday 7:00am-3:30pm
  • Overtime  and holiday availability required.
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Free meals on work days 
  • Pay Range is $32.25 - $36.50 per hour

The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications

  • 50-pound lifting requirement.
  • Valid Class C driver's license is required. 
  • Valid Class A is Highly preferred
  • 609 and 608 certified is highly preferred
  • Minimum 3 years of heavy automotive diesel mechanic experience is required
  • Experience with replacing A/C parts (i.e. compressor, filter/dryer, expansion valve, etc.)
  • Basic understanding of hydraulic systems and truck after-treatment systems is required 
  • Able to perform minor lift gate repairs
  • Completion of an accredited vocational diesel automotive school certificate is preferred 
  • Excellent communication skills and proven track record of dependability, attention to detail, and a strong commitment to achieve company cleanliness standards.

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.
