title: Project Service Technician II - Stockton/Sacramento area
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Project Service Technician II covering the Modesto/Lathrop/Sacramento/Stockton service area. The Project Service Technician II reports to a Service Supervisor and is responsible for the maintenance and cleaning of restaurant equipment, including cooking equipment, refrigeration units, heating and air conditioning systems, ice machines and other mechanical items. 

*Candidates must live within 30-mile radius from service area.

General Responsibilities
  • Inspect, clean, descale and sanitize Ice Machines and drink stations
  • Inspect A/C filters, belts, blower assemblies, and clean refrigeration coils
  • Inspect kitchen equipment for wear/tear and proper operation
  • Inspect overall condition of roof and surrounding areas
  • Travel to Store locations throughout service area

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Schedule: Four (4) 10-hour shifts, including holidays and weekends
  • Hours: 1:00 a.m. – 11:00 a.m.
  • Occasional overnight travel (8-day runs when out-of-state) 
  • Pay Range is $23.00 - $27.00 per hour 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors. 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • EPA certification and HVAC certification; preferred  
  • High School diploma required, some electrical coursework preferred
  • Minimum of one (1) year experience in refrigeration, plumbing, electrical troubleshooting and restaurant equipment repair; preferred
  • Intermediate knowledge of heating, air conditioning, refrigeration, plumbing, and electrical
  • Ability to disassemble and reassemble equipment using hand and/or power tools and use of a voltmeter
  • Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office  
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds 
  • Valid CA Driver’s License; required

title: Landscape Construction Supervisor
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

In-N-Out Burger has an excellent opportunity for a full-time Landscape Construction Supervisor based in our Baldwin Park, CA location. 
 
General Responsibilities
The Landscape Construction Supervisor position will be responsible for the landscape design and installation of new store locations, as well as landscape upgrades for existing locations throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Washington, New Mexico, Idaho and Tennessee. Approximately 80% of this individual’s time will be spent in the field, performing such duties as meeting with subcontractors and reviewing store landscape installations, completing irrigation system checks, and developing plans for small improvement projects. Most field assignments are multi-day trips involving overnight stays and will vary throughout the year based on new store construction schedule.

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt
  • Varying Hours, but typically: Monday-Friday, 6:00 am - 3:00 pm
  • Travel: Approximately 80% of the Landscape Construction Supervisor’s time is spent in the field; 20% of the time is spent in the office in Baldwin Park
  • Overnight travel will be required
  • Most assignments are day trips; however, assignments at distant locations may involve a one or two night hotel stay 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance 
  • Pay Range is $86,850-$108,500  
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications
  • High School Diploma or GED required 
  • Minimum of 2 - 4 years’ experience in landscape and irrigation design, installation and maintenance
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in a supervisor role
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Proficient computer application skills including AutoCAD, Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Pest control methods experience a plus
  • Must possess a valid California Driver’s license

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. We have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Human Resources Project Coordinator
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

The In-N-Out Burger Human Resources team has an excellent opportunity for an HR Project Coordinator based out of our Irvine, CA* office. 

*This position is full-time, in-office only

General Responsibilities:

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented HR Project Coordinator to support internal HR initiatives and projects. This role is ideal for someone who is organized, communicative, and eager to work closely with cross-functional teams to help drive HR process improvements, system implementations, and compliance efforts. The HR Project Coordinator will help plan and manage projects, provide support to various teams, and ensure timely communication and documentation throughout the project lifecycle.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate and support internal HR projects, particularly smaller-scope initiatives or segments of larger projects under the guidance of a Project Manager.
  • Develop and maintain project execution documentation including timelines, task lists, and status reports.
  • Serve as the central point of contact for project stakeholders; manage project communications to ensure alignment and timely updates.
  • Understand project scope, timelines, resource requirements, and deliverables from the initial planning phase.
  • Collaborate with HR teams to support project progress and identify potential challenges or dependencies.
  • Organize and lead team meetings, manage progress updates, and support structured workflows to ensure timely task completion.
  • Anticipate and escalate project roadblocks, issues, or changes in scope to appropriate team members or leadership.
  • Use tools such as Asana, Jira, Teams, or email to track project status and maintain visibility across all stakeholders.
  • Assist in the creation of rollout materials and deliver clear, engaging presentations for HR team updates and training sessions.
  • Ensure all projects are aligned with HR policies, regulatory requirements, and organizational goals.
  • Maintain a strong understanding of HR operations, compliance, and best practices to ensure quality and consistency across initiatives.

Work Schedule + Benefits:

Full-time, Hourly/Salary, Non-Exempt/Exempt
Hourly Pay Range/ Pay Range: $26.50 - $29.25 per hour
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
Department needs may call for occasional evenings and weekends
Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance


Qualifications:
  • 1+ years previous experience in HR coordination, project coordination, or a related role.
  • Familiarity with project management tools and communication platforms (e.g., Jira, Asana, Teams).
  • Strong organizational, time management, and communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Understanding of HR policies, compliance, and internal team dynamics.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other documentation tools.


Work Location Details

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger

About In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas and Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order food prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

title: Executive Assistant to VP of Store Development
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

The In-N-Out Burger Store Development team has an excellent opportunity for an Executive Assistant to support the Vice President of Store Development, located in Baldwin Park, CA*.  The ideal candidate is a proactive professional with exceptional communication and multitasking skills who can manage confidential information with discretion. This role requires flexibility, adaptability, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while embodying and representing In-N-Out’s culture of friendliness and service. 

*This role is based full time in office

General Responsibilities
  • Deliver high-level executive support by autonomously managing complex calendars, meetings, and sensitive communications to optimize the VP’s time, priorities, and workflow
  • Support the execution of special initiatives and executive projects on behalf of the VP to advance strategic goals and organizational outcomes
  • Oversee administrative workflows and delegate work to support staff while cultivating internal and external relationships to extend the VP’s influence and operational effectiveness
  • Conduct research and compile executive reports and summaries to support decision-making and inform leadership discussions
  • Prepare and organize materials for speeches, conferences, and meetings to ensure executive preparedness, presence, and impact
  • Coordinate complex travel and logistics to keep the VP agile, efficient, and focused across locations and engagements

Work Schedule and Benefits
  • Full-time position, Non-exempt
  • Office Hours in Baldwin Park, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Department needs will call for occasional overtime
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Pay Range is $44.00-$57.00 per hour 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications & Skills:
  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration or a related field; preferred
  • Legal/Real Estate Development background; preferred 
  • 7+ years of experience in an administrative role, including at least 5+ years of advanced executive leadership support experience 
  • Strong organizational and time-management skills with attention to detail
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently, handle multiple priorities, and meet deadlines
  • Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) 
  • Strong proficiency with collaborative project management software (e.g. Asana)
  • Experience with making travel arrangements and planning/scheduling department meetings/outings 
  • Discretion and ability to handle confidential information with integrity
  • Excellent conflict-resolution and problem solving skills 
  • Continuously demonstrates a proactive and positive mindset 
  • Excellent critical thinking and ability to quickly adapt to change
  • Strong service-orientation and interpersonal skills; ability to interact professionally with all levels within the organization


About In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Executive Assistant to VP of Human Resources
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

In-N-Out Burger has an excellent opportunity for a Executive Assistant, located in the Irvine, CA office*.  

Seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Executive Assistant to support the Vice President of Human Resources. The ideal candidate is a proactive professional with exceptional communication and multitasking skills who can manage confidential information with discretion. This role requires flexibility, adaptability, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while representing In-N-Out’s culture of friendliness and service. 

*This role is based full time in office.  Must be interested in relocating to the Franklin, TN area with the Vice President on or after Fall 2027 (timing is flexible).

General Responsibilities
  • Deliver high-level proactive administrative support by autonomously managing complex calendars and scheduling of meetings. 
  • Screen and prioritize emails, phone calls, and other communications.
  • Assist in drafting, reviewing, and distributing correspondence and communications.
  • Support the execution of special initiatives and executive projects as needed
  • Conduct research and compile executive reports and summaries.
  • Coordinate travel logistics, including reservations and itineraries.
  • Handle confidential and sensitive information with professionalism and discretion.
  • Collaborate with other Executive Assistants in a positive and productive manner.
  • Act as a liaison between the VP of HR and internal/external stakeholders.
Work Schedule and Benefits
  • Full-time position, Non-Exempt
  • Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Position needs will call for occasional overtime
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Hourly Pay Range:  $44.00 - $57.00
The above represents the expected hourly range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Human Resources, or a related field preferred.
  • Minimum of 7 years of experience, including at least 5 years of advanced executive support experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently, handle multiple priorities, and meet deadlines.
  • Strong organizational and time-management skills with attention to detail.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact professionally with all levels within the organization.
  • Excellent problem-solving and decision making skills
  • Discretion and ability to handle confidential information with integrity.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and HR software tools.
Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948. 

About In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Spread Room Operator
description_html:
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Spread Room Operator in our Chino, CA production facility. 

General Responsibilities:

  • Manual stacking of cases
  • Operating packaging equipment to build pallets
  • Cleaning and sanitation work
  • Constructing edible product
  • Other activities as directed by the supervisor

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Pay Range: $24.00-$27.00 per hour DOE
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Must be available to work the following shifts which will rotate every two months: 
    • Monday through Friday (6AM-2:30PM)
    • Monday through Friday (2PM-10:30PM)
    • Sunday through Thursday (10PM-6:30AM)
  • Department needs call for weekend and holiday scheduling
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or GED
  • A minimum of one (1) year experience working in a meat facility, food processing plant, or similar warehouse experience (preferred)
  • Forklift certification (preferred)
  • Must be a self-starter and demonstrate a high degree of accuracy and thoroughness
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management
  • Represent the company in a positive and professional manner

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 35 degrees Fahrenheit and stand for up to eight (10) hours on a continuous basis
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 75 lbs. 

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger:


In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. title: Sanitation Technician I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Sanitation Technician in our Chino, CA warehouse.  The Sanitation Technician will work afternoon/evening shifts in the Meat processing department earning and hourly wage of $23.00-$25.75 DOE plus benefits.


General Responsibilities:

  • Be directly responsible for cleaning and sanitizing the commissary plant equipment
  • Clean large food processing equipment; Chemicals will be used during the sanitation process
  • Responsible for operation of sanitation equipment such as the pressure washer
  • Wash and sanitize all commissary plant property using proper cleaning procedures
  • Clean meat crates and blue plastic pallets/crates
  • Clean and sanitize food processing equipment, roof, fans, ceilings, walls and floors using specific procedures as directed
  • Use all proper cleaning procedures so that it meets with both In-N-Out Burger and USDA standards
  • Assist in reassembling equipment when necessary
  • Monitor and document chemical concentrations to ensure proper cleaning of equipment
  • Follow all safety policies and procedures at all times

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Pay Range: $23.00-$25.75 per hour            
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Hours: 4:00 p.m. to 12:30 a.m.; some overtime as needed (start times may vary)
  • 5 nights per week, rotating schedule and alternating days off
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Job Requirements:

  • High school diploma or GED
  • One (1) year experience working in a meat facility or similar responsibilities
  • One (1) year Sanitation or Janitorial  experience, preferably in a food processing plant
  • Ability to read chemical labels and follow safe handling procedures for  all chemicals used in cleaning activities

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.
  • Ability to climb tall ladders and not be afraid of heights
  • Ability to withstand varied environmental conditions, such as cold and heat, extreme wet, within closed surroundings
  • Will work in an environment that is wet, damp, and humid; will undergo temperature changes from hot to cold
  • Will wear rain gear while hosing down equipment
  • Exposure to chemical cleaning solution (with protective gear)
  • Production rooms are warm when cleaning them: 70-80 degrees
  • Occasional work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit
  • Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling
  • Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Senior HR Business Partner
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!
   
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Senior Human Resources Business Partner based in our Lathrop, CA office! 

The Senior Human Resources Business Partner (Sr. HRBP) reports to the Regional HR Manager and plays a pivotal role in providing strategic HR support to our Stores and highly complex Corporate Departments. This position serves as a trusted advisor in supporting organizational goals and objectives, workforce planning and performance management. The Senior HRBP also leads and supports key HR projects and initiatives, demonstrating advanced expertise in HR disciplines and competencies.

General Responsibilities
  • Serve as a trusted advisor to assigned Stores, highly complex Support Departments, and business leaders, addressing medium- to complex employee relations issues.
  • Make strategic management recommendations impacting team performance and coach managers to keep employees accountable for meeting goals.
  • Conduct regular meetings with team leaders to understand talent requirements and business goals. Drive talent review and assessments by facilitating succession and performance calibration sessions.
  • Coach business leaders on the appropriate tools and resources for team development, championing mentorship programs, leadership development, and training.
  • Prepare internal equity analysis and provide recommendations for Support leaders addressing outcomes related to job offers, promotions, transfers, terminations, and strategic management decisions impacting team performance.
  • Work in partnership with other HR functions to contribute to key HR projects, including process workflows, change management, and workforce planning.
  • Drive the strategy and lead larger projects contributing to multiple areas of the organization, such as the annual performance review process.
  • Develop insights from people data (engagement surveys, exit interviews, etc.) to inform talent acquisition, development, and retention strategies.
  • Provide ongoing development, training, and mentorship for HR team members.

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt
  • Office Hours in Lathrop,CA : Monday-Friday, 8AM - 5 PM or a 9/80 compressed workweek with core hours from 8AM-6PM, with every other Monday or Friday off.
  • Occasional Saturday shifts (8 AM- 5 PM) required (approximately 5 per year).
  • Some scheduling flexibility is required for off-site meetings and travel to satellite offices.
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans, and Pet Insurance
  • Pay Range: $115,000-$140,000
  • The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications
  • BA/BS degree in a relevant field or equivalent years of HR experience; a Master’s degree in human resources or a related field is a plus.
  • 8+ years of Human Resources experience, with a background in providing HR support to both corporate and field-based teams. 
  • 5+ years of proven experience as a strategic HRBP with experience in talent development, succession planning, compensation, performance management, and workforce planning.
  • Demonstrated ability to coach business leaders using effective communication, active listening, and motivational techniques for team development.
  • Striving for excellence and aspirational in talent management initiatives.
  • Proven ability to collaborate effectively with other HR functions and departments, demonstrating strong interpersonal skills and adaptability in various project environments.
  • Demonstrated project management skills, including planning, execution, and monitoring, with the ability to drive the strategy and lead projects contributing to organizational goals.
  • Ability to influence project outcomes and gain support from key stakeholders.
  • Demonstrates a bias for action and a driven approach to achieving strategic goals.
  • Experience in providing ongoing development, training, and mentorship to HR team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth within the team.

About In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas and Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

description_text:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Night Sanitation Technician in our Lathrop, CA warehouse.  The Sanitation Technician will work evening shifts in the Meat processing department.
General Responsibilities
Be directly responsible for cleaning and sanitizing the commissary plant equipment
Clean large food processing equipment; Chemicals will be used during the sanitation process
Responsible for operation of sanitation equipment such as the pressure washer
Wash and sanitize all commissary plant property using proper cleaning procedures
Clean meat crates and blue plastic pallets/crates
Clean and sanitize food processing equipment, roof, fans, ceilings, walls and floors using specific procedures as directed
Use all proper cleaning procedures so that it meets with both In-N-Out Burger and USDA standards
Assist in reassembling equipment when necessary
Monitor and document chemical concentrations to ensure proper cleaning of equipment
Follow all safety policies and procedures at all times
Work Schedule + Benefits
Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
Pay Range: $23-$23.50 per hour
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
Hours: 4:00 p.m. to 12:30 a.m.; some overtime as needed (start times may vary)
5 nights per week, rotating schedule and alternating days off
Weekend and holiday availability required
Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
Job Requirements:
High school diploma or GED
One (1) year experience working in a meat facility or similar responsibilities
One (1) year Sanitation or Janitorial experience, preferably in a food processing plant
Ability to read chemical labels and follow safe handling procedures for all chemicals used in cleaning activities
Physical Demands/Requirements
Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.
Ability to climb tall ladders and not be afraid of heights
Ability to withstand varied environmental conditions, such as cold and heat, extreme wet, within closed surroundings
Will work in an environment that is wet, damp, and humid; will undergo temperature changes from hot to cold
Will wear rain gear while hosing down equipment
Exposure to chemical cleaning solution (with protective gear)
Production rooms are warm when cleaning them: 70-80 degrees
Occasional work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit
Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling
Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings

title: Marketing Graphic Designer II
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

In-N-Out Burger has an excellent opportunity for a full-time Marketing Graphic Designer II based in our Irvine, CA* location. This position is primarily responsible for the creation of content and elements for in-house and customer facing materials.  This can include the opportunity to contribute to the design of commemorative and historical materials, merchandise, and apparel.  This role will also assist with developing and versioning branding materials for internal events, and crafting/developing a visual voice for all In-N-Out Burger social media channels and its charitable foundations.  

The Marketing team at In-N-Out Burger works on a wide variety of projects with an emphasis on offering creative and personal development opportunities; encouraging each team member to continually grow their knowledge and skill set.  The team strives to foster a culture of collaboration in order to achieve larger goals in a supportive environment.   
 
*This position is full-time, in-office only.
 
General Responsibilities
  • Timely completion and delivery of creative for projects underway and smaller creative solutions from start-to-finish. This includes but is not limited to social media, smaller brand signage and elements, event collateral, digital banners/pop ups/content, and interdepartmental creative support
  • Editing existing creative to fit current direction; includes versioning for multifaceted projects
  • Image and photo editing including but not limited to retouching/clean up, post editing, and manipulation based on predetermined direction of project stakeholders or other designers 
  • Collaborating with other designers and creative team members to produce final project elements or deliverables, including creative reviews/critiques 
  • Collaborating and consulting with other company departments to advise on creatives

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance 
  • Pay Range is $33.00-$37.00 per hour 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications
  • 3-5 years of Graphic Design and Marketing experience required 
  • High School diploma or GED required 
  • Some college preferred (Marketing and or Graphic Design courses a plus)
  • Proficient in web based graphics including formatting, optimization, and on screen considerations
  • Understanding of typography, layout, color and graphic design principles
  • Understanding/working knowledge of the printing process and paper
  • Ability to take projects from concept development to production
  • Ability to multi-task and manage time efficiently to deliver quality work under tight deadlines
  • Adobe creative suite – photoshop, illustrator, InDesign experience required
  • Motion graphics software is a plus
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Computer literacy in both word processing and spreadsheet functions
  • Strong customer service skills
  • For Store associates:
    • Minimum one (1) year tenure with In-N-Out Burger
    • Minimum Level 3
    • No Final Warnings in the last six (6) months and must be in good standing with Management

Work Location Details

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948. We have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Administrative Assistant II
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  


We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Administrative Assistant II on the Incentive Trips and Travel team. The admin will work in the Incentive Trips and Travel department in Irvine, CA*. and reports to the Incentive Trips and Travel Manager. 

  

*This role is a full-time, in office position.  

  

General Responsibilities 

  • Responsible for administrative tasks and projects for the Manager of the Incentive Trips and Travel department, such as heavy calendaring, scheduling meetings, answering phones, handling requests, and drafting and managing correspondence.  
  • Help manage department calendars, schedule and assist with planning meetings and team building activities, community service projects and workshops including location and logistics.  
  • Prepare meeting materials, including agendas, PowerPoint presentations and collection of relevant data from other team members. 
  • Book travel and process expenses using Concur. 
  • Work with budgets in MS Excel. 
  • Coordinate department special events, such as parties and lunches, birthdays and anniversaries, welcoming of new department hires including onboarding plans. 
  • Develop strong working relationships throughout the company as an extension of the Department Manager. 
  • Keep department and company information confidential with the highest degree of integrity 
  • Collaborate with other departments or functions. 
  • Be part of a team-oriented department and assist in other areas as needed.  


Work Schedule + Benefits 

  • Full-time, Non-Exempt 
  • Salary Range: $28.00 - $31.00 per hour 
  • The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.  
  • Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm  
  • Department needs will call for occasional evenings and weekends 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

  

Qualifications 

  • 2-5+ years of experience in a high-level Administrative Assistant, Executive Assistant or relevant role required. 
  • Must be a self-starter and demonstrate a high degree of confidence and ability to anticipate needs and execute when necessary. 
  • Passion for providing excellent administrative and clerical support to the department. 
  • Strong computer proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint). Asana and Concur a plus.  
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills. 
  • Act as a trusted partner to management, displaying the highest levels of integrity and handling highly sensitive and confidential information. 
  • Strong customer service skills and the ability to interact with all levels of internal and external customers in a positive and professional manner. 
  • Excellent time management skills organized and the ability to prioritize work. 
  • Ability to work autonomously/independently under general supervision. 

Work Location Details

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948. We have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Operational Sanitation/Crate Wash
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Operational Sanitation Associate in our Chino, CA Meat Department. This Associate’s primary work duties will include the daily pre-operational duties and the cleaning of meat crates during production. 

General Responsibilities:

  • Primary Duties
    • Preoperational inspection- Ensure all machines, equipment, and utensils are properly cleaned and ready for use
    • Cleaning of meat crates
    • Conduct chemical checks throughout the shift
    • Use all proper cleaning procedures to ensure that both In-N-Out Burger and USDA standards are achieved
    • Understand and follow all safety policies and procedures at all times
    • Be able to communicate with all associates and supervision to a minimum level required to warn of a dangerous condition
    • Must be self-motivated and able to work without constant supervision
    • Attention to detail (Condition of equipment and  Cleanliness )

  • Secondary Duties:
    • Assisting Operational Sanitation ( i.e. mid shift sanitation in Meat Receiving, Boning Room and Patty Room)
    • Washing vats 
    • Dry pick up in production areas 

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Pay Range: $23.00 to $25.50/hourly DOE
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Day Hours: Must be available to start as early as 4:00AM 
  • 5 days per week (Rotating Schedule)
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or GED
  • One (1) year experience working in a meat facility or similar responsibilities (Preferred) 
  • Sanitation experience in a food processing plant   
  • Forklift or electric pallet jack (Preferred)
  • Ability to read chemical labels and follow safe handling procedures for food products

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs. 
  • Ability to climb ladders and work at heights
  • Ability to withstand varied weather conditions, such as cold and heat, extreme wet, within closed surroundings
  • Will work in cold, damp environments.
  • Production room temperatures are as low as 26 degrees Fahrenheit
  • Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling
  • Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.
In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Warehouse Worker
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Warehouse Associate in our Draper, Utah warehouse. The Warehouse Worker will be responsible for pulling food orders from storage areas to prepare for sending out to the restaurants.

General Responsibilities

• Order pulling on a routine basis: Moving food items from storage areas to the shipping pallet

• Physically pull orders from shelves and load them onto forklifts

• Transport packed items onto the shipping pallet; assist in loading onto the delivery truck

• Receiving and entering all paperwork into the computer, such as invoices, production sheets and inter-store

• Reviewing daily delivery reports and report any discrepancies

• Making special deliveries to the In-N-Out stores using a company vehicle, van or refrigerated Bobtail truck

Work Schedule + Benefits

• Full-time, Hourly, Benefit

• Thursday - Sunday 8am to 6:30pm (Subject to change)

• Overtime as needed; Weekend and holiday availability required

• Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) Plan

• Free meals on work days

Job Requirements:

• High school diploma or GED (required)

• A minimum of one (1) year experience as an Order Puller

• Ability to lift 60-75 lbs. on a continuous basis

• Demonstrated ability to perform at a high degree of accuracy and thoroughness

• Computer proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook; proficiency in PowerPoint a plus

• Exceptional oral and written communication skills

• Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management and outside organizations

• Represent the company in a positive and professional manner

• Valid non-commercial Utah driver’s license (required)

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

• Receiving and entering all paperwork into the computer, such as invoices, production sheets and inter-store
• Reviewing daily delivery reports and report any discrepancies
• Making special deliveries to the In-N-Out stores using a company vehicle, van or refrigerated Bobtail truck
Work Schedule + Benefits
• Full-time, Hourly, Benefit
•
Thursday - Sunday 8am to 6:30pm (Subject to change)
• Overtime as needed; Weekend and holiday availability required
• Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) Plan
• Free meals on work days
Job Requirements:
• High school diploma or GED (required)
• A minimum of one (1) year experience as an Order Puller
• Ability to lift 60-75 lbs. on a continuous basis
• Demonstrated ability to perform at a high degree of accuracy and thoroughness
• Computer proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook; proficiency in PowerPoint a plus
• Exceptional oral and written communication skills
• Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management and outside organizations
• Represent the company in a positive and professional manner
• Valid non-commercial Utah driver’s license (required)
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.
In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Supply Chain Project Manager I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 


This position will report to the Supply Chain PMO Manager and will be responsible for project managing all activities related to assigned projects or program. This role is responsible for planning, organizing, executing, and overseeing projects to ensure they are completed on time, within budget, and to the required INO standards, while also managing resources, stakeholders, and risks. This role is responsible for managing and ensuring that critical meetings are scheduled in collaboration with Administrative Support Associates, and conflicts are proactively resolved. This role will also help develop materials and designs for presentations for Supply Chain teams.

*Please note that this is a full-time in-office position.

General Responsibilities

  • Plan and organize larger scope projects from their start to completion, including creating & maintaining any required Project Execution documents
  • Responsible for coordinating/leading meetings, updating the project’s progress using various mediums (email, Slack, Asana, Teams, etc.), and prioritizing work based on the customer’s needs
  • Help develop rollout materials and design presentations for update meetings/trainings with the Supply Chain Team and customers
  • Communicate any issues, roadblocks, or scope creep to necessary parties
  • Understand project’s timeline, resources, and scope from the project’s kick-off
  • Responsible for managing tasks and communicating effectively to all members of the project until it reaches the support phase
  • Retrieve data from a variety of sources to identify outcomes and opportunities
Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Free meals on work days
  • Pay Range is $36.82 -$38.50 per hour 
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s in Supply Chain, Business Administration or Operations (Required) 
  • 5+ years Project Management (Required)
  • Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
  • Possesses the ability to quickly learn and understand the fundamentals of In-N-Out’s Supply Chain infrastructure & applications

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Time and Labor Systems Analyst III
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Oracle Time and Labor Systems Analyst based in our Irvine, CA location*. This person reports to the HRIS Manager and is responsible for contributing to the development, testing, implementation, and on-going administration of payroll systems, including Oracle Cloud ERP. 

The Oracle Time and Labor (OTL) HRIS Analyst is responsible for the configuration, maintenance, and administration of the Oracle Time and Labor module, as part of the Human Resources Information System (HRIS). The analyst ensures that the OTL system operates efficiently, meets the business requirements of the organization, and supports timekeeping and labor tracking across multiple departments. 

*This position is 100% in office and will be based in Irvine, CA.

Responsibilities

 * Payroll Systems Management: Perform system maintenance, assisting in the review, testing, and implementation of payroll systems including, but not limited to, Oracle/ERP systems, Kronos, and reporting tools. 
 * Configure and maintain Oracle Time and Labor (OTL) modules to support business requirements.
 * Develop and modify Fast Formulas to meet complex timekeeping and payroll rules.
 * Collaborate with functional and technical staff to coordinate application of upgrade or fix. 
 * Maintain payroll system tables, and document process and results. 
 * Configure, develop, and independently manage multiple Oracle modules. Present the solutions to a problem in a logical manager to the supervisor and stakeholders. 
 * Conduct a thorough analysis of the impact of a change across the entire landscape of systems. 
 * Write complex reports/queries utilizing appropriate Oracle reporting tools. 
 * Develop standard and custom reports for ongoing customer needs. 
 * Build scorecards and dashboards that present the data in a highly visual, concise, and logical manager.
 * Maintain data integrity in systems by running queries and analyzing data. 
 * Provide production support, including researching and resolving Oracle problems, unexpected results or process flaws; performing scheduled activities; recommending solutions or alternate methods to meet requirements. 
 * Manage projects and process improvement, including applying change management experience to facilitate movement to new levels of quality. 
 * Optimize payroll systems processes by integrating the software/systems to build a highly integrated and automated set of processes. 
 * Perform audits on payroll processes, documents, and data. Takes action that is consistent with available facts, constraints, and consequences. 
 * Maintain specialization across the Oracle platform through constantly learning new technologies, attending User Group seminars/conferences, Online/In Person/CBT training, books, and journals. 
 * Maintain awareness of current trends in payroll systems management with a focus on product development, delivery and support, and applying key technologies. 
 * Continuously increases payroll and payroll systems application/tools knowledge. 
 * Champion process/customer service improvements and innovative solutions. Uses process and technical know-how to obtain appropriate approval prior to implementation. 
 * Conduct trainings, develops user procedures and guidelines. 
 * Trains clients on new processes/functionality, and new system users.

Work Schedule + Benefits

 * Full-time, Salaried, Exempt
 * Pay Range is $106,600 - $133,200 annualized salary. This represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors. 
 * Office Hours: Mon-Fri, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
 * Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Finance, Accounting, Information Systems or related field required.
7+ years of configuration and development experience in Oracle. Relevant experience in other ERP systems will also be considered.  
7+ years of experience with Oracle Payroll modules, including Time and Labor. 
Preferred experience with UKG 
Excellent SQL and fast formula skills.
Strong understanding of quantitative/qualitative measurement and data/system design principles.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent organization skills and attention to details.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience with a programming language and PL/SQL preferred.
Excellent project and time management skills.
Proficient with MS Office, MS Excel and other financial software tools. Experience with a Project Management Tool preferred.

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: HRIS Analyst I
description_html:
Come join our Family at In-N-Out Burger!

The In-N-Out Burger Human Resources team has an excellent opportunity for a HRIS Systems Analyst, located in the Irvine, CA office*.  The Systems HRIS Analyst’s primary focus is to design develop, test, implement and, administer the human resource information systems (HRIS) systems, with a primary focus on Oracle Cloud HCM. This position serves as a technical point of contact and oversees user acceptance testing of system changes, analyzing process flows for process improvement opportunities and optimizing HR systems. This person will collaborate with the HR functional team to define requirements and lead the system configuration, testing, troubleshooting, and maintenance of Oracle HCM modules. 

The HRIS Systems Analyst also participates in HRIS upgrades, patches, fixes, testing and other technical projects as assigned. This position will be responsible for providing level 2 support to Associates across In-N-Out, in technical matters related to HRIS. They will develop user training materials and maintain documentation for their work.

*This role is based full time in office

General Responsibilities
  • Perform system maintenance and application upgrades, including keeping up with Oracle’s periodic updates, assisting in the review, testing and implementation of Oracle Cloud HCM system (Core HR, Benefits, Compensation, Absence, Talent Management, HR Help Desk, HCM Analytics). Collaborate with functional and technical staff to coordinate application upgrade/fix. Maintain HRIS system tables. Document process and results. Configure, develop and independently manage Oracle Cloud HCM modules.
  • Collaborate with HR functional experts and other departments to understand functional needs and define requirements.
  • Provides production support, including researching and resolving technical and functional issues, unexpected results or process flaws; performing scheduled activities; recommending solutions or alternate methods to meet requirements.
  • Optimize HRIS processes by integrating the software/systems to build a highly integrated and automated set of processes.
  • Perform audits on HR processes, documents and data. Take action that is consistent with available facts, constraints and consequences.  
  • Maintain specialization in the specific areas of responsibilities through constant learning the new technologies and best industry practices.
  • Maintains awareness of technological advancements and current trends in HRIS. Continuously increase both HR and HRIS application/tools knowledge.
  • Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions, to be approved by appropriate leadership prior to implementation.
  • Conduct training; Develop user procedures, guidelines, and training.
  • Create and maintain master structural data in the system (i.e., Dept./Org tree, Job code, location etc.) 
Work Schedule and Benefits
  • Full-time position, Exempt
  • Onsite, in office hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Department needs will call for occasional overtime
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Salary Pay Range: $106,000 - $133,000* 
*Represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent 
  • 2-5 years of experience in Core HR and multiple of the following modules within Oracle Cloud HCM: Benefits, Compensation, Talent Management, Help Desk, Absence preferred
  • 3-7 years of proven work experience as HRIS analyst or similar role
  • Expertise in writing complex SQLs preferred
  • Experience in writing Fast Formula preferred
  • Understanding of quantitative/qualitative measurement and data/system design principles
  • Excellent Verbal and Written communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate, provide technical support and train staff. Proven experience in documenting processes, running diagnostic tests and audits
  • Excellent organization skills and attention to details
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with a programming language and PL/SQL preferred
  • Excellent Time Management Skills
  • Ability to work independently under a general guidance
  • Experience with a Project Management Tool or certifications as HRIS analyst preferred
Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

About In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Wastewater Treatment Operator I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Wastewater Treatment Operator I working within the Meat Department, based out of our warehouse located in Lancaster, Texas.

The Wastewater Treatment Operator reports to the Maintenance Supervisor in the Meat Department and is responsible for the proper operation and maintenance of the onsite wastewater treatment plant in order to comply with local and state regulations which includes daily sampling and chemical adjustment as needed, basic mechanical checks, level monitoring and sending samples off for lab analysis. Qualified individuals will be critical thinkers that are able to understand chemistries as it relates to pH, BOD & TSS and make adjustments as needed to ensure acceptable effluent of our wastewater stream.

General Responsibilities:

  • Perform daily rounds of WWTP documenting issues as they arise
  • Perform regular maintenance of WWTP system
  • Will troubleshoot WWTP system, address mechanical issues, including but not limited to motor swaps and pump repairs
  • Take water samples daily and analyze for Turbidity and pH (adjust chemical dosing as required)
  • Perform preventative maintenance on all aspects of the WWTP system as needed to ensure proper care and operation
  • Communicate any alarms/issues to supervisor as to prevent any untreated discharge to the water company
  • Take monthly samples for external lab analysis and regulatory compliance
  • Document all chemical levels and order replenishments as needed
  • Will respond to alarms after hours (as needed from time to time)

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Pay Range: $26.48-$35.00 per hour 
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors. 
  • Schedule- May vary according to the needs of the business, but typically range from 8:00 am-4:30 pm, Sunday thru Thursday
  • Some overtime as needed
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 3 years related experience
  • High School Graduate or equivalent
  • Ability to understand and comply with local permitting authorities
  • Wastewater Treatment Plant Operators Certificate Grade II or higher (required)

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift 100 lbs.
  • Ability to work in high, precarious places
  • Ability to work near moving mechanical machinery
  • Ability to work in wet, humid conditions

description_text:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Wastewater Treatment Operator I working within the Meat Department, based out of our warehouse located in Lancaster, Texas.
The Wastewater Treatment Operator reports to the Maintenance Supervisor in the Meat Department and is responsible for the proper operation and maintenance of the onsite wastewater treatment plant in order to comply with local and state regulations which includes daily sampling and chemical adjustment as needed, basic mechanical checks, level monitoring and sending samples off for lab analysis. Qualified individuals will be critical thinkers that are able to understand chemistries as it relates to pH, BOD & TSS and make adjustments as needed to ensure acceptable effluent of our wastewater stream.
General Responsibilities:
Perform daily rounds of WWTP documenting issues as they arise
Perform regular maintenance of WWTP system
Will troubleshoot WWTP system, address mechanical issues, including but not limited to motor swaps and pump repairs
Take water samples daily and analyze for Turbidity and pH (adjust chemical dosing as required)
Perform preventative maintenance on all aspects of the WWTP system as needed to ensure proper care and operation
Communicate any alarms/issues to supervisor as to prevent any untreated discharge to the water company
Take monthly samples for external lab analysis and regulatory compliance
Document all chemical levels and order replenishments as needed
Will respond to alarms after hours (as needed from time to time)
Work Schedule + Benefits:
Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
Pay Range: $26.48-$35.00 per hour
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
Schedule- May vary according to the needs of the business, but typically range from 8:00 am-4:30 pm, Sunday thru Thursday
Some overtime as needed
Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
Qualifications:
Minimum 3 years related experience
High School Graduate or equivalent
Ability to understand and comply with local permitting authorities
Wastewater Treatment Plant Operators Certificate Grade II or higher (required)
Physical Demands/Requirements:
Ability to lift 100 lbs.
Ability to work in high, precarious places
Ability to work near moving mechanical machinery
Ability to work in wet, humid conditions

title: Driver I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Delivery Driver in our Lancaster, TX warehouse. The Delivery Driver will be responsible for the delivery and rotation of product to our In-N-Out Burger restaurant locations and satellite warehouses. 

About Our Fleet:
  • 389 Peterbilt Classic Day Cabs
  • Quiet Reefer (Carrier brand)
  • 13-speed transmission/Eaton
  • Great Dane trailer with lift gates and electric pallet jack (no ramps)

General Responsibilities
  • Operate company truck to provide daily deliveries to In-N-Out Burger restaurants located in Texas (Austin, Dallas, San Antonio, and Houston regions)
  • Be responsible for the delivery and rotation of product
  • Ensure that our customers receive only the freshest, highest quality ingredients
  • Operate an electric pallet jack, forklift, lift gates, hand trucks, dolly
  • Move large product racks
  • Establish and maintain excellent customer service relationships
  • Complete some warehouse duties such as loading/unloading trucks, warehouse sanitation, and order pulling for the store deliveries
  • Perform all duties with pride; Work well in an atmosphere of teamwork and cooperation

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Hours: 12:30 am – 11:00 am or 10:00 pm - 8:30 am (start times may vary)
  • Four (4) nights per week; 10-hour shifts
  • Weekend and holiday availability required; Overtime as needed  
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Free meals on workdays 

Job Requirements:
  • High school diploma or GED (required)
  • A minimum of two (2) years experience as a CDL holder delivery driver (required)
  • A minimum of two (2) years experience Food Service delivery, restaurant or beverage delivery experience (preferred)
  • Valid Class A driver’s license (required)
  • Smith System certified driver (preferred)
  • Ability to lift 60-75 lbs. on a continuous basis
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management
  • Strong initiative; Ability to work independently and follow through safely and accurately on assignments with minimal supervision
  • Must be able pass a company administered driving test and be able to properly operate a 10-speed and 13-speed transmission
  • Must be able to drive a manual transmission

title: Journeyman Painter
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time, temporary Journeyman Painter in Las Vegas, NV.  This position will be responsible for the prep and painting of In-N-Out Burger restaurant locations and other company facilities throughout Nevada and may travel to Utah, Idaho, Arizona, and California.

General Responsibilities
  • Paint the interior and exterior of In-N-Out Burger restaurants and other company facilities
  • Use brush and roller, airless, HVLP, and a variety of paint products
  • Make on-site preparations such as building scaffolding, covering fixtures, etc.
  • Prepare walls and other surfaces for painting by scraping, using sandpaper, removing old paint, etc.
  • Operating, maintaining and cleaning all equipment
  • Completing necessary paperwork
  • Completion of work orders and projects in a timely manner
  • Pre-painting preparation including supply estimation, scraping, patching, sanding and clean up
  • Follow all health and safety precautions

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time position, Hourly, Non-Exempt 
  • 4 nights per week, 10-hour shifts  
  • Work Days: Tuesday–Friday  --  mostly no weekends!
  • Hours: Graveyard shift: 12:00 a.m. to 10:30 a.m.
  • Warehouse location: Las Vegas, NV.  Ideally the candidate would live within 45 minutes of the Las Vegas warehouse
  • Travel: Driving is required throughout all of Nevada as well as Utah, Idaho, Arizona, and California
  • Travel: 45% travel out of town and out of state, including overnight hotel stays for up to a week or more
  • Company Van and Painting tools will be provided
  • Excellent full-time Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) retirement Plan


Qualifications
  • Minimum of two (2) years experience as a Painter
  • Successful completion of a Painting apprenticeship preferred
  • Excellent knowledge of painting material and how to select, mix and apply them
  • Ability to use appropriate tools (paint brushes, caulking guns, etc.)
  • Familiarity with OSHA general safety practices for the painting industry preferred
  • Ability to travel and be out of town for up to a week or more; Out of town travel can occur once a month or every other month, depending on the Painting project
  • In-N-Out Burger associate/store experience preferred; Must be in good standing with the store 
  • Great attention to detail
  • Represent the company in a positive and professional manner
  • Physical requirements: Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs. 
  • Valid Nevada Driver's License 
  • High school diploma or GED




ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.
