title: Service Technician IV - Salt Lake City area
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time, experienced Maintenance Service Technician covering our Salt Lake City, UT market. The Maintenance Service Technician needs to be HVAC certified, and will work for the Service department.

*Candidates must live within 30-mile radius from service area.

General Responsibilities
  • Maintenance and repair of all In-N-Out Burger restaurant equipment – Cooking equipment, A/C units, refrigeration, plumbing, light carpentry, door, shelves, etc.
  • Working well independently with little or no supervision
  • Traveling to the In-N-Out stores in your region at a moment’s notice, in case of emergencies
  • Observing all safety guidelines and maintaining the cleanliness of your specific work area

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Schedule: Five (5) days a week, rotating schedule including holidays and weekends
  • Hours: 7:00 a.m. – 3:30 p.m., occasional on-call availability required
  • Travel is required (25%) and it is preferred if this individual lives in close proximity to the Salt Lake City area 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Pay Range is $34.00-$39.00 per hour 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications
  • Must have EPA certification and HVAC certification
  • A minimum of three (3) years’ experience in working in refrigeration, air conditioning repair, restaurant equipment repair
  • Strong electrical troubleshooting and repair experience
  • Knowledge of High Voltage AC Power (3 Phase)
  •  ‘Soda Fountain’ and trade school experience is a plus
  • Strong experience working as a Maintenance tech on commercial jobs
  • A valid UT Driver’s License is required (Company vehicle provided)

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. title: Senior Program Officer - Slave 2 Nothing Foundation
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

The In-N-Out Burger Community Engagement team has an excellent opportunity for a Senior Program Officer based out of our Irvine, CA* office. 

This position will report to the Foundation Supervisor and support In-N-Out Burger’s Slave 2 Nothing Foundation. The Senior Program Officer is responsible for supporting strategic grant-making and community engagement by assessing grantees, creating advocacy programs, and managing fund allocation to enhance the Foundation's impact and visibility. 

The Slave 2 Nothing Foundation was established to educate and support nonprofits working to eliminate human trafficking, as well as focus on those fighting substance abuse.

*This position is full-time, in-office only

General Responsibilities
  • Assess potential grantees by performing thorough due diligence to ensure alignment with the Foundation's mission and priorities, verifying they meet the Foundation's standards and requirements, and ensuring strategic use of resources.
  • Plan and conduct site visits to build relationships with non-profits and evaluate their programs for potential funding.
  • Create and execute programs that advocate priority causes and enhance community awareness.
  • Work closely with Marketing, Communications, and Project Management teams to ensure cohesive and impactful community engagement strategies.
  • Guide the grantmaking process by conducting reviews, ensuring due diligence, and making high-level grant recommendations.
  • Establish and maintain meaningful relationships with community organizations to foster long-term partnerships and collaboration.
  • Contribute to the strategic planning of events, projects, and special initiatives, aligning them with Foundation and company goals.
  • Oversee the responsible management and allocation of Foundation funds to maximize impact and efficiency.

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Salary, Exempt
  • Pay Range: $77,000-$90,000
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Department needs will call for occasional evenings and weekends
  • Travel: Approximately 20–50% of work time will be spent in the field, including required out-of-state travel.
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Nonprofit Management, Social Work, Public Administration, or a related field required; Master’s degree or MBA preferred.
  • Certification in Grant Management, Grant Writing, Project Management, or Nonprofit Management is highly desirable.
  • Minimum of 6 years of nonprofit management experience, with a focus on grant making or a closely related field.
  • Proven experience in strategic planning, relationship building, and advocacy within the nonprofit sector.
  • Direct service experience in substance abuse recovery, with a strong commitment to supporting this community.
  • Strong communication, public speaking, and interpersonal skills.
  • Highly organized, with exceptional time management and resource management skills.
  • Advanced analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills, with the ability to adapt to change.
  • High emotional intelligence paired with strong critical thinking capabilities.
  • Proficiency with nonprofit CRM systems, project management tools (e.g., Asana, Trello), and the Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Knowledge of budgeting, financial management, and analysis tools.

Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger

About In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas and Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order food prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

ABOUT the Community Engagement Department
The In-N-Out Burger Foundation was established in 1995 with the goal of raising funds to assist abused and neglected children in the communities where we live and do business.

In 2016, the Slave 2 Nothing Foundation was established to educate and assist in solutions to eliminate human trafficking as well as focus on those needing treatment, rehabilitation, and prevention from drug/alcohol abuse. Our Fundraising Team supports both foundations with small and large scaled fundraising efforts and collaborates with Community Impact on volunteer opportunities for our In-N-Out Burger Associates and their families.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Property Administrator
description_html:
Come join the Real Estate family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Property Administrator based in our Baldwin Park, CA* Real Estate office.  The Property Administrator will report to the Real Estate Asset Manager, and is responsible for supporting and assisting Property Managers with their day-to-day responsibilities as it relates to managing the real estate portfolio of In-N-Out Burger.  Background in real estate Finance or real estate Accounting is preferred. 

*This position is full-time, in-office only

General Responsibilities
  • Liaison between external vendors such as Landlords and Property Managers, and internal groups such as Operations Support Center (OSC), Restaurants (Stores), and Maintenance team on common area maintenance service requests
  • Communicate and coordinate with all parties on the status of the request, from initial receipt, to scheduling and completion
  • Assist Property Managers with processing payment of real estate taxes, tracking tax appeals, processing invoices and updating audit schedules to ensure invoiced correctly by tax consultant; support annual budget process
  • Assist with managing NRP rent/lease and vendor invoices and coordination with Accounts Payable to ensure payment
  • Process and distribute mail from landlords, contractors, and other third parties for the Property Management team
  • Maintain highly organized e-filing system for leases, tenants, insurance certificates, vendors, contracts and other related documents
  • Manage CAM reconciliations using Excel schedules; verify and identify any discrepancies 
  • Research and contract or schedule appropriate parties (vendor, city personnel, Caltrans) for store maintenance, lighting, or landscape issues in public right-of-way
  • Process payment and reporting of percentage rent to landlords per lease
  • Process public notices from the city/county by mapping out the distance from the nearest store; and research and summarize the issue to provide necessary information to the corresponding Property Manager
  • Maintain and update landlord Certificates of Insurance and coordinate with landlords to provide them the current vendor certificates upon request
  • Process monthly distribution of vouchers to landlords and licensees, ensuring all are received on time with proof of delivery
  • Maintain and update as necessary all landlord property management contact information in CoStar, OneNote, and Property Management spreadsheet 
  • Provide support with the lease administration software “CoStar” by verifying the information is accurate, populating clauses, and making any necessary edits to complete each store record 
  • Provide other administrative support to the Real Estate and Property Management team as needed

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Pay Range is $25.00-$28.00 per hour
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm 
  • Office location: Baldwin Park, CA
  • Some scheduling flexibility is required for occasional off-site meetings and travel to satellite offices
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • High School Diploma; required 
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Real Estate, Business, Finance, Accounting or related field; preferred
  • 2-3 years of experience in Commercial Leasing, Lease Administration, Property Management, or Commercial real estate accounting 
  • Knowledge of real estate economics and real estate financial analytics experience; preferred
  • Knowledge in General accounting, commercial leases, real estate
  • Exceptional analytical skills; ability to combine financial analysis and business objectives 
  • Knowledge of commercial real estate leases and contracts including interpretation and documentation    
  • Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional groups 
  • Strong negotiation skills; Must be comfortable negotiating business terms and administering to legal documents 
  • Experience and willingness to deal with dispute resolution matters 
  • Ability to work both independently and within a team environment 
  • Able to work on multiple projects simultaneously, be a self-starter
  • Solid experience in Microsoft Office as well as Lease Administrative/Accounting software, including Visual Lease and CoStar
  • Knowledge of shopping center maintenance operations 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
  • Strong customer service focus 


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon r

title: Warehouse Worker
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Warehouse Worker in our Phoenix, AZ warehouse.  The Warehouse Worker will pull orders, prepare orders for delivery, receive and process warehouse products; may perform other warehouse functions as needed.

General Responsibilities
  • Order pulling on a routine basis: Moving food items from storage areas to the shipping pallet
  • Physically pull orders from shelves and load them onto trucks
  • Responsible for keeping products separated, organized and in good rotation
  • Transporting packed items onto the shipping pallet; load onto the delivery truck
  • Perform any combination of receiving, storing and distributing tasks to assist in the distribution of product
  • Pulling and preparing store product orders using an electric riding pallet jack, forklift, and hand-truck for delivery
  • Maintain accurate inventory
Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Hours: 2:00 pm – 12:30 am
  • Four (4) days per week, rotating schedule
  • Weekend and holiday availability required; Overtime as necessary
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Free meals on work days 
Job Requirements:
  • High school diploma or GED (required) 
  • Valid Arizona Driver's License
  • 1-2 years warehouse experience, or Order Puller experience (preferred)
  • 1-2 years experience working in a meat facility, food processing plant, or similar warehouse experience (preferred)
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills
  • Dependable and Reliable; Excellent time management skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management
Physical Demands/Requirements
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 60-75 lbs.
  • Ability to work with heavy machinery
  • Experience using an electric riding pallet jack, forklift, and hand-truck for delivery (preferred)

About In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Construction Project Manager I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Construction Project Manager based in our Baldwin Park, CA Real Estate construction office, in the New Construction department.  The Construction Project Manager (CPM) will direct and oversee multiple concurrent assigned regional construction projects, from real estate development conception and hand off to construction completion, while monitoring compliance with In-N-Out Burger specifications, safety, and building regulations.  They will work with construction and development teams to build In-N-Out Burger restaurants.  This person reports to the Senior Construction Project Manager. 

The New Construction department is responsible for the building and development of In-N-Out Burger restaurants.  This team works closely with other real estate development and construction teams.

General Responsibilities
  • Manage multiple General Contractors across several geographic markets
  • Support internal superintendents across multiple new store build locations
  • Review, comment and report on bids, potential change orders, payment applications, project schedule, submittals, RFI’s, and weekly reports
  • Make regular site visits to ensure the store and surrounding site are constructed in accordance with the construction documents and to In-N-Out Burger prototype details, and standard of workmanship
  • Assure all projects are constructed to the highest level of quality that represents In-N-Out Burger, including documenting and following up on multiple quality control walks throughout the project with additional team members
  • Effectively create, manage, and report on project schedules to ensure timely and successful store turnovers to the operations teams
  • Review all project due diligence documents and construction drawings to ensure a successful bid process and smooth construction build
  • Work with and transition projects from internal Development Managers to New Store Construction
  • Work with internal Design partners and external architects, engineers, and consultants throughout the construction of each project
  • Communicate with site developers and sellers prior to and throughout the construction build process
  • Coordinate and schedule both internal/external installers and vendors throughout the project
  • Communicate and work with all authorities having jurisdiction (AHJ) on the project from the onset of construction through the Certificate of Occupancy
  • Partner with applicable utility companies to ensure timely installation of services to maintain store completion and turnover schedules
  • Ensure compliance with company, industry, trade and safety standards; practices and codes
  • Collaborate on prototype plans and standards

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt
  • Pay Range is $108,500-$135,700
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Work Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Office location: Baldwin Park, CA
  • Travel: Approximately 40% - 50% of time will be spent in the field, traveling to project sites in CA, NV, AZ, TX, UT, OR, CO, ID, WA, TN, and NM.
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Construction Management, Architecture or Civil Engineering; preferred  
  • 6-7+ years of experience working as a commercial construction project manager on multiple ground-up building projects with associated site work; restaurant construction project management preferred
  • Ability to travel weekly, locally and out of town, multiple days a week, with the remainder of time spent in the Baldwin Park office 
  • CA driver’s license in good standing
  • Strong proficiency with reading, comprehending, and interpreting all types of architectural and engineering plans, specifications; and reports 
  • In-depth understanding of and able to interpret building codes 
  • Proficient in MS Office Suite, including Outlook, Teams, Word, and Excel
  • Familiarity with Smartsheet
  • Strong proficiency in construction project scheduling software (i.e. Microsoft Project or Primavera) 
  • Proven experience using construction project management software (i.e. Procore, PlanGrid, or Autodesk Construction Cloud)
  • Strong problem-solving skills 
  • Effective communication and negotiation skills 
  • Positive attitude and eager to be a part of and represent the In-N-Out family 
  • Valid CA driver's license is required 


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Maintenance Tech III
description_html:
We have an excellent opportunity for two full-time Meat Department Maintenance Technician III in our Lancaster, TX Meat Warehouse.  The Maintenance Technician III will be responsible for the preventative maintenance and repairs of machinery in the Meat department for In-N-Out Burger. Currently we have openings on second shift and third shift with a starting pay range of $33.86/HR- $39.58/HR DOE. 

General Responsibilities:

  • Perform mechanical setup, fine tune settings, and troubleshoot VFFS (Vertical form, fill, and seal) equipment
  • Maintain and repair water heaters and CIP equipment
  • Document work orders and preventative maintenance activities
  • Troubleshoot PLC I/O and field devices (Prox sensors, photo eyes, thermocouples)
  • Troubleshoot AC/DC High and low voltage circuits (3 Phase 480/230V and 24V)
  • Troubleshoot servo drives, VFD’s, and AC motors
  • Maintain and repair diaphragm/PD/centrifugal pumps, food processing piping, metal detectors, process tanks, and conveyors

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Starting Pay Range: $33.86/HR- $39.85/HR per hour DOE
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Hours: 
    • Second Shift- Monday- Friday (1:00PM- 11:30PM)
  • Some overtime as needed
  • 5 days per week 
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications:

  • Perform job duties with a heighten level of detail 
  • Proficiency in using a MMS system 
  • Experience within a liquid processing environment, including a solid foundation of Pneumatics, Hydraulics, Electrical/Electronic, Welding & Fabrication a plus
  • Basic knowledge of PLC/ plant automation a plus
  • Ability to read Electrical schematics
  • Ability to interpret mechanical drawings


Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs. 
  • Cold working conditions - Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit; Temperature fluctuations in the warehouse  
  • Ability to move freely in and around obstacles common in the meat production room 

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Community Engagement Systems Coordinator (Temp)
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

The In-N-Out Burger Community Engagement team has an excellent opportunity for a temporary Community Engagement Systems Coordinator based at our Irvine, CA* office. This is a full-time, two-year contract role through 2027. 

This temporary role reports to the Community Engagement Programs Manager and provides essential support for technology initiatives within the Community Engagement department. Responsibilities include managing project documentation, assisting with requirements gathering, coordinating vendor demos and meetings, and supporting execution efforts to ensure projects stay on track.  

This role works closely with the Systems Administrator and Project Manager to maintain organization, ensure timely progress, and support smooth transitions between project phases—resulting in seamless and well-coordinated delivery of both current and future initiatives. 

General Responsibilities 

Pre-Project Planning & Documentation 
  • Own the documentation for pre-project planning, including team shadowing, process documentation, and requirements gathering. 
  • Maintain department software tracker with current technology solutions for the department. 
  • Research viable solutions for department technology or process needs, and arrange demos for team members, helping narrow down to preferred options. 
  • Start drafting initial project charters for upcoming technology projects. 

Scheduling & Coordination 
  • Schedule meetings with project stakeholders, ensuring conference rooms are booked and vendors are included as necessary. 
  • Oversee the creation and updating of SOPs and data flowcharts in LucidChart, ensuring all relevant stakeholders have access to accurate project documentation.

Project Execution & Oversight 
  • Support the relationships with software implementation partners (such as Rosetree & Fionta) to ensure current projects move forward on time and according to plan. 
  • Oversee data integrity within technology platforms, including managing data import/export processes and data removal/archival. 
  • Keep Asana tasks updated, provide weekly status updates on projects, and move deliverables along through phases. 
  • Communicate effectively cross-functionally and inter-departmentally, encouraging technology user adoption and cohesive process management. 
  • Respond promptly to emails & MS Teams messages, especially when working with project stakeholders or external vendors.

Vendor & Solution Research 
  • Assist in researching and evaluating technology solutions for departmental needs, leveraging reputable sources and input from the IT team. 

Work Schedule + Pay Details  
  • Temporary assignment, 2 years through 2027 
  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt  
  • Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm  
  • Hourly Rate: $30.00 - $35.00 
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors. 

Qualifications 
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Technology Project Management, or a related field.  
  • 2–4 years of experience in project coordination, business analysis, or systems support. 
  • Project Management certification highly preferred. 
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills across all levels of the organization. 
  • Skilled in documentation, requirements gathering, and process mapping. 
  • Experience coordinating meetings, vendor demos, and supporting technology initiatives. 
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. 
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office and project tools such as Asana; familiarity with LucidChart and Cvent a plus. 
  • Experience with nonprofit systems (e.g., CRM, donor management, event registration, fundraising software, or other SaaS tools); Salesforce highly preferred. 
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. 
  • Stays calm and flexible while handling multiple high-priority projects under pressure. 
  • Passion for community service and mission-driven work. 

Work Location Details 
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948. 

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger. 
 
ABOUT the Community Engagement Department 
The In-N-Out Burger Foundation was established in 1995 with the goal of raising funds to assist abused and neglected children in the communities where we live and do business.   

In 2016, the Slave 2 Nothing Foundation was established to educate and assist in solutions to eliminate human trafficking as well as focus on those needing treatment, rehabilitation and prevention from drug/alcohol abuse. Our Fundraising Team supports both foundations with small and large scaled fundraising efforts as well as collaborating with Community Impact on volunteer opportunities for our In-N-Out Burger Associates and their families. 

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request. 

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger 
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948. We have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.  

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Social Media Coordinator
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

In-N-Out Burger has an excellent opportunity for a full-time Social Media Coordinator based in our Irvine, CA* location. This position reports to the Social Media & Digital Manager and is primarily responsible for assisting departments in the development, coordination, and execution of various social media content and marketing strategies and materials.  
 
*This position is full-time, in-office only.
 
General Responsibilities
  • Maintain an organized content calendar for daily execution, ensuring posts are timely, aligned with campaigns, product releases, and seasonal initiatives
  • Develop, curate, and schedule engaging social media content across platforms (Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok, Twitter) that aligns with the brand’s voice, goals, and marketing initiatives
  • Assist in tracking and analyzing performance metrics using tools like Google Analytics and Meta Insights, providing reports and basic recommendations for improving content effectiveness
  • Execute and coordinate recurring paid social media campaigns (e.g., HR hiring ads) and approved organic content, ensuring they meet deadlines and adhere to brand standards
  • Monitor social media activity, engage with followers, and address comments or inquiries to maintain the brand’s reputation, including supporting Customer Service during critical or high-priority moments
  • Collaborate with internal teams (Marketing, Creative, Customer Service, Legal) to ensure messaging consistency and compliance with brand and legal guidelines across all channels
  • Organize and execute promotions for events, ticket sales, and merchandise, ensuring content aligns with campaign goals and providing reports on outcomes.
  • Content management/cataloguing images 

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance 
  • Pay Range is $30.00-$35.00 per hour 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications
  • 1-3 years' experience in digital marketing and social media management; required
  • Bachelor's degree preferred in Marketing, Business Communication or related field; courses should have an emphasis on Marketing, Digital, e-commerce, etc. 
  • Social Media Marketing or Digital Marketing certifications (i.e. Hootsuite, Google Analytics, Meta Tools); desirable 
  • Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics and social monitoring tools
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook) and Asana 
  • Advanced knowledge of social media platforms (Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, Canva, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.)
  • Proven track record of managing social media accounts and executing campaigns 
  • Experience with content creation, copywriting, and visual storytelling  
  • Highly organized with strong project management skills 
  • Ability to multi-task and manage time efficiently to deliver quality work under tight deadlines
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate professionally with all levels of the organization
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively and be an integral part of an overall team environment 
  • Must be self-motivated, an ongoing learner and committed to staying current on ever changing social technology platforms and trends
  • Ability to maintain strict confidentiality 
  • For Store associates:
    • Minimum one (1) year tenure with In-N-Out Burger
    • Minimum Level 3
    • No Final Warnings in the last six (6) months and must be in good standing with Management

Work Location Details

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948. We have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Driver I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Delivery Driver currently based in our Chino, CA warehouse. 
The Delivery Driver will be responsible for the delivery and rotation of product to our In-N-Out Burger restaurant locations and satellite warehouses. 

About Our Fleet:

  • 389 Peterbilt Classic Day Cabs
  • Quiet Reefer (Carrier brand)
  • 13-speed transmission/Eaton
  • Great Dane trailer with lift gates and electric pallet jack (no ramps)

General Responsibilities

  • Operate company truck to provide daily deliveries to In-N-Out Burger restaurants located in Southern California
  • Be responsible for the delivery and rotation of product
  • Ensure that our customers receive only the freshest, highest quality ingredients
  • Operate an electric pallet jack, forklift, lift gates, hand trucks, dolly
  • Move large product racks
  • Establish and maintain excellent customer service relationships
  • Complete some warehouse duties such as loading/unloading trucks, and order pulling for the store deliveries
  • Perform all duties with pride; Work well in an atmosphere of teamwork and cooperation

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Start time: 12:00 am - 10:30am (10-hour shifts)
  • Four (4) nights per week; Rotating Schedule
  • Weekend and holiday availability required; Overtime as needed  
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Free meals on work days  
  • Pay is $39.00 per hour 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications

  • High school diploma or GED (required)
  • A minimum of two (2) years experience as a CDL holder delivery driver (required)
  • A minimum of two (2) years experience Food Service delivery, restaurant or beverage delivery experience (preferred)
  • Valid Class A driver’s license (required)
  • Smith System certified driver (preferred)
  • Ability to lift 60-75 lbs. on a continuous basis
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management
  • Strong initiative; Ability to work independently and follow through safely and accurately on assignments with minimal supervision
  • Must be able pass a company administered driving test and be able to properly operate a 10-speed and 13-speed transmission
  • Must be able to drive a manual transmission
 

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Plumber Intermediate
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Plumber to cover the In-N-Out Burger stores in Southern California, Southern Nevada, Arizona, and Nevada. The Plumber is based out of the Baldwin Park, CA warehouse, and will be responsible for troubleshooting, servicing, and repairing Plumber-related issues at the In-N-Out Burger restaurants.

General Responsibilities

  • Install, maintain, and repair plumbing systems and fixtures for In-N-Out Burger restaurants throughout the company
  • Perform sewer repairs
  • Perform gas and water line repairs
  • Locate and repair issues with water supply lines, such as leaks, etc.
  • Troubleshoot, service, and complete repairs to plumbing systems of current restaurants
  • Repair or replace broken drainage lines, clogged drains, faucets, etc.
  • Use augers, snakes, cameras, remodels and new system installations
  • Maintain the cleanliness of their work area


Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Pay Range for Beginner Plumber is $28.44 - $32.00 per hour
  • Pay Range Intermediate Plumber is $31.50 - $35.00 per hour
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition.  Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • 4 nights per week, 10-hour days
  • Hours: Graveyard shift: 12:00 a.m. to 10:30 a.m.; overtime as needed
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Travel: 40-50% of the time Plumbers will be out of town or out of state; Travel required to the states where In-N-Out Burger operates
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance


Qualifications

  • Plumbing repair and remodel experience preferred.
  • Professional plumbing experience in residential or commercial service and repair preferred.
  • Solid understanding of water distribution and disposal systems in commercial, industrial, or restaurant buildings preferred.
  • Extensive travel schedule – must be able to travel out of town/out of state for up to 8 days at a time
  • A Valid California Driver's License
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.
  • Good physical condition and strength with the ability to work in awkward spaces
  • Familiarity with Uniform Plumbing Codes
  • Strong customer service orientation; Friendly
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills; Be able to interact with all levels of management and outside organizations to represent the company in a positive and professional manner

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Linen Delivery Driver
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Linen Delivery Driver in our Lathrop, CA warehouse.  The Linen Delivery Driver is responsible for delivering linen to and from the Lathrop warehouse to the In-N-Out Burger restaurants.

General Responsibilities
  • Load truck (Stepvan) with clean linen at the Lathrop warehouse
  • Deliver clean linen to various In-N-Out stores, then hang linen in the dressing room
  • Collect soiled linen and load onto truck
  • Drive 200-400 miles per shift around northern California, collecting linen
  • Return to Lathrop warehouse and unload bags of soiled linen   

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Warehouse location: Lathrop, CA
  • Pay Range is $22.56-$24.00 per hour 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Four (4) nights per week; Rotating Schedule
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Shift hours: Graveyard: 1:00 am – 11:30 am
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Job Requirements:

Qualifications
  • High school diploma or GED
  • Valid California Driver's License and clean driving record
  • Ability to drive long drives and many miles per shift
  • Ability to lift 60-75 lbs. on a continuous basis
  • Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management in a professional manner
  • Strong customer service orientation

  • Ability to maintain confidentiality

title: Business Property Tax Accountant
description_html:
Come Join Our Family!

We are excited to offer an exceptional full-time opportunity for a Business Property Tax Accountant based in our Irvine, CA office*. Reporting to the Tax Manager, this position is responsible for the preparation and filing of annual business property tax returns for all company-required locations. This includes preparing reconciliation schedules, handling property tax audits, maintaining the fixed asset system for tax purposes, and managing all property tax-related reports. Additionally, the role involves reviewing and processing a variety of government permits and licenses, preparing various tax filings, and maintaining accurate records for fixed asset accounting.
*This position is full-time, in-office only.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Prepare and file annual business personal property tax returns for all states and process related payments.
  • Process, renew, and manage all mandated health, safety, business licenses/permits, ensuring compliance with city, county, and state regulations.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve business license, permit, and operational license issues.
  • Maintain an updated calendar of expiration dates to ensure timely filing and renewals of required licenses/permits.
  • Assist in property tax audits by providing requested information and responding to assessor’s inquiries.
  • Maintain fixed assets for tax purposes, including processing fixed asset additions, transfers, disposals, and cost adjustments.
  • Prepare and file various miscellaneous tax filings, which may include but are not limited to tourism assessments, environmental fees, and gross receipts taxes.
  • Prepare cost segregation schedules for all new store openings.
  • Handle escheatment reporting and census forms
  • Support ad hoc projects as needed..

Work Schedule & Benefits
  • Pay Range is $45.92-$52.81/hr*. Represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Onsite, in office hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm. Department needs will call for occasional overtime
  • Full-time position, Non-Exempt

Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field is required.
  • 3-5 years of experience in business personal property tax and fixed asset accounting/tax accounting is required.
  • Experience with permits and licenses and unclaimed property is a plus.
  • Strong understanding of business personal property tax and GAAP knowledge, specifically in fixed assets.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced Excel skills.
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to problem-solve effectively.
  • Detail-oriented with a high degree of accuracy.
  • Exceptional relationship-building skills with strong communication abilities.
  • Excellent organizational and follow-up skills; able to handle multiple tasks within deadlines and with precision.
  • Ability to maintain and update records and ensure compliance with regulations.


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.
Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger

Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
Onsite, in office hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm. Department needs will call for occasional overtime
Full-time position, Non-Exempt
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field is required.
3-5 years of experience in business personal property tax and fixed asset accounting/tax accounting is required.
Experience with permits and licenses and unclaimed property is a plus.
Strong understanding of business personal property tax and GAAP knowledge, specifically in fixed assets.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced Excel skills.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to problem-solve effectively.
Detail-oriented with a high degree of accuracy.
Exceptional relationship-building skills with strong communication abilities.
Excellent organizational and follow-up skills; able to handle multiple tasks within deadlines and with precision.
Ability to maintain and update records and ensure compliance with regulations.
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.
In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.
Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.
Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger

title: Regional Real Estate Manager
description_html:
Come join the Real Estate family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Regional Real Estate Manager based in the Southern California area.  The Regional Real Estate Manager reports directly to the Department Manager of Real Estate for In-N-Out Burger.  This person will be responsible for new store acquisitions and store development for In-N-Out Burger in California, as well as surrounding states.  


General Responsibilities
  • Serve as a real estate contact for In-N-Out Burger
  • Responsible for generating new restaurant/store locations in assigned territory 
  • Research, create and manage market strategy in connection with new store opening goals; Understand local market conditions
  • Select and manage local brokers to implement market strategy and identify sites
  • Prepare, tour and present real estate packages to executive committee for approval
  • Negotiate LOIs, Ground Leases, and Purchase/Sale Agreements in collaboration with legal teams to acceptable In-N-Out standards
  • Collaborate with design, development and construction teams on site plan, project development, and related timelines to meet new store opening goals
  • Provide professional real estate expertise within the specified market
  • Works extensively across internal functions and with external partners, including, but not limited to: operations, legal, finance, construction, developers, landlords, governmental authorities and neighborhood groups
  • Participate in weekly calls and meetings with corporate via conference calls and in person
  • Attend ICSC events and other networking functions on behalf of In-N-Out Burger

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt
  • Pay Range is $134,000 - $180,000
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors. 
  • Office location: Baldwin Park Real Estate Office 
  • Travel time: 50% of the time will be spent in the field; will require occasional overnight travel for territory management and various meetings
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Real Estate, Business, or related field
  • 5+ years demonstrated experience in: 
    • Retail or Restaurant real estate development 
    • Commercial real estate management in a restaurant, quick service restaurant, or retail environment.  Quick-service restaurant with Drive-Thru experience a plus
    • Site selection/deal making experience in the restaurant industry (required), preferably quick service restaurants
  • Business and Negotiation acumen in real estate; Demonstrated deal making ability
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, presentation skills, and strong relationship skills
  • Strong customer service orientation
  • Creative problem solving abilities and outstanding organizational skills
  • Tech savvy; Strong computer proficiency; Excellent in MS Office applications and GIS applications
  • Strong attention to detail and good time management
  • Highly motivated, self-starter
  • Valid CA driver's license required 
    •

title: Driver I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Delivery Driver in our Gresham, OR  NEAR PORTLAND OR warehouse (please note this role will be based in Woodland OR. until the Gresham warehouse is completed) The Delivery Driver will be responsible for the delivery and rotation of product to our In-N-Out Burger restaurant locations and satellite warehouses. 

About Our Fleet:

  • 389 Peterbilt Classic Day Cabs
  • Quiet Reefer (Carrier brand)
  • 13-speed transmission/Eaton
  • Great Dane trailer with lift gates and electric pallet jack (no ramps)
General Responsibilities

  • Operate company truck to provide daily deliveries to In-N-Out Burger restaurants located in northern California
  • Be responsible for the delivery and rotation of product
  • Ensure that our customers receive only the freshest, highest quality ingredients
  • Operate an electric pallet jack, forklift, lift gates, hand trucks
  • Move large product racks
  • Establish and maintain excellent customer service relationships
  • Complete some warehouse duties such as loading/unloading trucks, and order pulling for the store deliveries
  • Perform all duties with pride; Work well in an atmosphere of teamwork and cooperation
Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Hours: 12am – 10:30 am 
  • Four (4) nights per week; Rotating Schedule
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) Plan
  • Free meals on work days 
  • Pay: $39.00 per hour (Starting)

Job Requirements:

  • High school diploma or GED (required)
  • A minimum of two (2) years experience as a CDL holder delivery driver (required)
  • Experience with direct store or restaurant delivery experience (preferred)
  • Must be comfortable working and driving in inclement weather
  • Ability to lift 60-75 lbs. on a continuous basis
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management
  • Strong initiative; Ability to work independently and follow through safely and accurately on assignments with minimal supervision
  • Valid Class A driver’s license (required) with a clean driving record
  • Must be able pass a company administered driving test and be able to properly operate a 10-speed and 13-speed transmission
  • Must be able to drive a manual transmission
 

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Sanitation Assistant Supervisor
description_html:
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Night Sanitation Assistant Supervisor based in Chino, CA. The Night Sanitation Assistant Supervisor will report to the Sanitation Supervisor and is responsible for overseeing the sanitation process of our Chino meat and spread production facility and for ensuring that our standard sanitation operating procedures (SSOPs) are aligned with industry best practices and in compliance with regulations from OSHA, USDA, and other regulatory agencies.

 The Night Sanitation Assistant Supervisor is a working leader who spends much of their time on the production floor supporting the Sanitation Supervisor oversee the cleaning of production rooms and equipment. This includes assisting with onboarding and training of the team, providing timely feedback on performance, maintaining chemical levels, and performing pre-op inspections of the rooms. This requires 5+ years’ experience in industrial cleaning of production equipment in a USDA-setting, with demonstrated excellent interpersonal and communication skills. It’s preferred that the Sanitation Assistant Supervisor has prior leadership experience and is bi-lingual (Spanish). 

Job Duties: 

  • Assist in the growth and development of the sanitation associates and leads. 
  • Create one-point lessons, standard operating procedures, and maintain training programs for sanitation associates. 
  • Provide timely feedback and ensure all Associates are complying with safety standards and sanitation expectations.
  • Coordinate the master sanitation schedule. 
  • Prepare and set-up equipment, chemicals, and other necessary items for the start of the shift.  
  • Conduct chemical checks throughout the shift.  
  • Inspect and complete all paperwork (Tool Checklist, Pre-Op Sheet, Chemical check sheet, Attendance sheet, etc.)  
  • Pre-Operational Inspection: Ensure all machines, equipment, and utensils are properly cleaned to meet In-N-Out Burger and USDA Standards.   
  • Serve as a back-up to the Supervisor and support when needed. 
  • Ensure that the team runs fully staffed and support when needed. 

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Compensation Range: $33.25 - $37.50/hour DOE
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Approx. Hours: 3:00 p.m. to 1:00 a.m.; some overtime as needed (start times may vary)
  • 5 days per week 
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications:

  • Experience leading large teams. (Preferred)
  • Bilingual (Spanish/ English preferred).
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to anticipate problems and solve them before they occur. 
  • Strong attention to detail.  
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. 
  • Experience in creating and implementing training programs. 
  • Experience coordinating and monitoring cleaning schedules.
  • Experience implementing corrective actions to ensure compliance.
  • HACCP certified a plus

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.
  • Ability to climb ladders and not be afraid of heights 
  • Ability to withstand varied environmental conditions, such as cold and heat, extreme wet, within closed surroundings 
  • Will work in cold, damp environments; will work in warm, damp environments 
  • Production rooms are warm when cleaning them: 70-80 degrees 
  • Occasional work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit 
  • Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: IT Project Manager
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

The In-N-Out Burger Information Technology team has an excellent opportunity for a full-time IT Project Manager , located in the Irvine, CA office*.  

The IT Project Manager will take on the responsibilities of planning, monitoring, controlling, and closing projects that involve the Information Technology (IT) department.  This Associate will report into the IT Project Management Office (PMO) Supervisor.  

*This role is based full time in office


General Responsibilities

* Plan and organize high value business and technology transformation projects from their start to completion, including coordinating the needs of multiple customers and many stakeholders.

*Responsible for managing project plans, work breakdown structures, tasks and communicating effectively to all members of the project until it reaches the support phase. 

*Understand and drive the project’s timeline, resources, and scope 

*Work closely with the Technical Leads to identify issues they will need to account for or areas in which they will need to lend their support 

*Responsible for coordinating/leading meetings, updating the project’s progress using various mediums (email, Slack, Asana, Jira, etc.)

*Help create presentations and rollout materials.

*Ability to communicate complex topics to executives in a simple, straightforward manner.

* Ability to understand low to medium technical complexity and communicate those details to the whole project team.


Work Schedule and Benefits

*Full-time position, Exempt
*Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
*Department needs will call for occasional overtime
*Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education *Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Salary Pay Range  97,655- $122,065 

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.


Qualifications

*In-N-Out Burger Store or Support experience: 1-2+ years
*Bachelor’s degree preferred; and/or 
*Store Leadership experience preferred, e.g. Shift person, Store Trainer, All Stars, etc.
*Must be computer and desktop PC savvy - Knowledge and use of Microsoft office suite programs
*Excellent written and verbal communication skills; Strong writing skills 


Additional Qualifications:

*Strong desire to be a Project Manager
*Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills 
*Ability to understand project requirements and drive projects forward
*Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization
*Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability and perseverance to identify and resolve complex issues
*Ability to work across multiple workstreams at the same time
*Ability to lead meetings and produce positive results


Work Location Details

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948. 

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.


About In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Finance Systems Business Analyst III
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

The In-N-Out Burger Accounting team has an excellent opportunity for a  Finance Systems Business Analyst III, located in the Irvine, CA office*.  

The Finance Systems Business Analyst III reports to the Finance Systems Manager and contributes to the development, testing, implementation, and on-going administration of finance systems, including Oracle Cloud ERP, as required. This role provides technical support, troubleshooting, and guidance to Support Associates and Managers and is responsible for testing financial system applications during system changes including enhancements, upgrades, and maintenance. Additionally, this role will develop and execute ad hoc queries, custom reports, data workflow processes, etc. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure the accuracy and efficiency of financial processes. 

*This role is based full time in office

General Responsibilities

*Financial Systems Management: Performs system maintenance, including assisting in the review, testing, and implementation of financial systems including, but not limited to, Oracle/ERP systems, budgeting and forecasting tools, and reporting tools. Collaborates with functional and technical staff to coordinate application of upgrade or fix. Maintains finance system tables. Documents process and results.

*Configures, develops, and independently manages multiple Oracle modules. Presents the solutions to a problem in a logical manager to the supervisor and stakeholders. Conducts a thorough analysis of the impact of a change across the entire landscape of systems.


*Writes complex reports/queries utilizing appropriate Oracle reporting tools. Develops standard and custom reports for ongoing customer needs. Builds scorecards and dashboards that present the data in a highly visual, concise, and logical manager. Maintains data integrity in systems by running queries and analyzing data.


*Provides production support, including researching and resolving Oracle problems, unexpected results or process flaws; performing scheduled activities; recommending solutions or alternate methods to meet requirements.


*Manages projects and process improvement, including applying change management experience to facilitate movement to new levels of quality.

*Optimizes finance systems processes by integrating the software/systems to build a highly integrated and automated set of processes.


*Maintains specialization across the Oracle platform through constantly learning new technologies, attending User Group seminars/conferences, Online/In Person/CBT training, books, and journals.

*Maintains awareness of current trends in finance systems management with a focus on product development, delivery and support, and applying key technologies. Continuously increases finance and finance systems application/tools knowledge.

*Champions process/customer service improvements and innovative solutions. Uses process and technical know-how to obtain appropriate approval prior to implementation.

*Conducts training, develops user procedures and guidelines. Trains clients on new processes/functionality. Trains new system users.



Work Schedule and Benefits

*Full-time position, Exempt
*Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
*Department needs will call for occasional overtime
*Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Salary Pay Range $108,933-$136,166   

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications

*Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent. Finance, Accounting, Information Systems or related field. Required

*Experience with ERP systems (e.g., SAP, Oracle) preferred.

*Strong SQL and fast formula skills.

*Understanding of quantitative/qualitative measurement and data/system design principles.

*Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

*Excellent organization skills and attention to details.

*Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

*Experience with a programming language and PL/SQL preferred.

*Excellent time management skills.

*Ability to work independently under a general guidance.

*Oracle-preferred

*7 years of Configuration and development in Oracle

*7 years of Finance and multiple modules within Oracle

*Proficient with MS Office, MS Excel and other financial software tools. Experience with a Project Management Tool preferred.

Work Location Details

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948. 

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

About In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.
