title: Journeyman Painter
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Painter based out of our Lathrop, CA facility.  This position will be responsible for the prep and painting of In-N-Out Burger restaurant locations and other company facilities throughout Northern California.

General Responsibilities
  • Paint the interior and exterior of In-N-Out Burger restaurants and other company facilities
  • Use brush and roller, airless, HVLP, and a variety of paint products
  • Make on-site preparations such as building scaffolding, covering fixtures, etc.
  • Prepare walls and other surfaces for painting by scraping, using sandpaper, removing old paint, etc.
  • Operating, maintaining and cleaning all equipment
  • Completing necessary paperwork
  • Completion of work orders and projects in a timely manner
  • Pre-painting preparation including supply estimation, scraping, patching, sanding and clean up
  • Painting of restaurants and other company facilities
  • Follow all health and safety precautions

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Temporary Full-time position, Hourly, Non-Exempt - This position can lead to a permanent position with in 90days
  • Pay Range is $26.50-$30.50 per hour (Journeyman Painter)       
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • 4 nights per week, 10-hour shifts  
  • Work Days: Tuesday–Friday  --  mostly no weekends! On-Call availability required
  • Hours: Graveyard shift: 12:00 a.m. to 10:30 a.m.
  • Department needs will call for occasional overtime
  • Warehouse location: Lathrop, CA.  Ideally the candidate would live within 40 miles of the Lathrop warehouse
  • Travel: Driving is required throughout northern California
  • Company van and Painting tools will be provided
  • Travel: 45% travel out of town and out of state, including overnight hotel stays for up to a week or more
  • In-N-Out Burger offers the following benefits to Temporary Associates:  401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan and sick time
    • Eligibility criteria must be met for 401k participation. 
  • Permanent Associate Benefits: Excellent full-time Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) retirement Plan

Qualifications
  • Minimum of two (2) years experience as a Painter
  • Successful completion of a Painting apprenticeship preferred
  • Excellent knowledge of painting material and how to select, mix and apply them
  • Ability to use appropriate tools (paint brushes, caulking guns, etc.)
  • Familiarity with OSHA general safety practices for the painting industry preferred
  • Ability to travel and be out of town for up to a week or more; Out of town travel can occur once a month or every other month, depending on the Painting project
  • In-N-Out Burger associate/store experience preferred; Must be in good standing with the store 
  • Great attention to detail
  • Represent the company in a positive and professional manner
  • Physical requirements: Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs. 
  • Valid California Driver's License 
  • High school diploma or GED

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Development Manager I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

In-N-Out Burger is growing!  Help us develop and build more restaurants... 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time real estate Development Manager I based in our Baldwin Park, CA* office.  The Development Manager is responsible for the entitlement, design coordination, and permitting processes for new ground-up In-N-Out Burger restaurants in various markets.

*This position is full-time, in-office only – Baldwin Park, CA


General Responsibilities
  • The real estate Development Manager will be responsible for all steps in the restaurant development process, starting from the entitlement process, up to permitting and through construction
  • Extensive preparation and knowledge of entitlement submittals
  • Manage the entitlement process and work well with city planners, governmental agency and local jurisdictions requirements
  • Restaurant Operations experience is desirable but not mandatory
  • Project Management, Entitlement Processing, and/or Design experience in Quick Service Restaurant (QSR) with drive-through/Quick Casual Industry is desirable but not mandatory
  • Must be well versed in all phases of real estate project management; including building design, entitlement, permitting
  • The Development Manager I will manage the whole entitlement process, due diligence, permit research, and completion of applications
  • Manage engineers, architects, geotechnical, environmental, survey and various other consultants relative to due diligence, entitlements, and permit procurement
  • Experience serving an Applicant advocate role with city council or city planning commissioners
  • Submitting for and obtaining governmental entitlements like CUPs, DRC approvals,  and ultimately all required permits to commence construction  
  • Experience with Design and preparation of site plans and building elevations is desirable.
  • Work closely with other development teams including Real Estate Managers (site acquisition team), Legal, and Construction, as well as with 3rd party developers, landlords, architects engineers and municipalities  
  • Working on multiple projects concurrently, in varying geographic locations, all of which may be in various stages of the development process
  • Manage various aspects of real estate development from site selection to construction completion  
  • Perform project site analysis, site design and pro-forma budget projection for presentation 
  • Negotiate development agreements and assist with real estate purchase and lease negotiations
  • Manage project budgets and schedules
  • Coordinate with jurisdictions and various public agencies during design review process and entitlements to obtain desired building design, site design and meet operational standards

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt 
  • Salary Range is $99,500-$125,000
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm 
  • Real Estate office is based in Baldwin Park, California
  • Requires significant field work and travel; will need to report to Baldwin Park, CA office
  • Travel time: 25% of the work time will be spent in the field and on pre-construction sites; will require occasional overnight travel to all seven states where INO operates
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • Five (5) years+ experience with the entitlement process; Must have a working understanding of governmental entitlement process (required)
  • Strong experience in the state of California - entitlement and permitting, including  processing of EIR’s and Mitigated Negative Declarations
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture, Civil Engineering or Construction Management (preferred); or a combination of experience and education
  • Ten (10) years’ experience in design, or management of design teams, and familiarity with working drawings and construction practices, methods, and materials.
  • Quick Service Restaurant industry experience preferred  
  • QSR Drive-thru experience preferred
  • Experience being an Applicant representative at city hearings
  • Experience working with city Planning Staff and Leaders, Design Review Boards, Planning Commissions, City Councils 
  • Must have good knowledge of building codes, Title 24, ADA, basic utilities and green code 
  • Must have an understanding of construction, and the relationship between value engineering and construction costs, scheduling and physical elements building
  • Will possess a strong work ethic, excellent organization and communication skills, along with the ability to observe safety guidelines and work both autonomously and in a team-oriented atmosphere  


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
Real Estate office is based in Baldwin Park, California
Requires significant field work and travel; will need to report to Baldwin Park, CA office
Travel time: 25% of the work time will be spent in the field and on pre-construction sites; will require occasional overnight travel to all seven states where INO operates
Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
Qualifications
Five (5) years+ experience with the entitlement process
; Must have a working understanding of governmental entitlement process (required)
Strong experience in the state of California - entitlement and permitting
, including  processing of EIR’s and Mitigated Negative Declarations
Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture, Civil Engineering or Construction Management (preferred); or a combination of experience and education
Ten (10) years’ experience in design, or management of design teams, and familiarity with working drawings and construction practices, methods, and materials.
Quick Service Restaurant industry experience preferred
QSR Drive-thru experience preferred
Experience being an Applicant representative at city hearings
Experience working with city Planning Staff and Leaders, Design Review Boards, Planning Commissions, City Councils
Must have good knowledge of building codes, Title 24, ADA, basic utilities and green code
Must have an understanding of construction, and the relationship between value engineering and construction costs, scheduling and physical elements building
Will possess a strong work ethic, excellent organization and communication skills, along with the ability to observe safety guidelines and work both autonomously and in a team-oriented atmosphere
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

title: Service Technician III
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time maintenance Service Technician IV covering our Denver, CO market! The Maintenance Service Technician needs to be HVAC certified and will work for the Service department.

*Candidates must live within 30-mile radius from service area

General Responsibilities
  • Maintenance and repair of all In-N-Out Burger restaurant equipment - cooking equipment, A/C units, refrigeration, plumbing, light carpentry, door, shelves, etc.
  • Working well independently with little or no supervision
  • Traveling to the In-N-Out stores in your region at a moment’s notice, in case of emergencies
  • Observing all safety guidelines and maintaining the cleanliness of your specific work area

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Pay Range: $34.00 - $36.00
  • Hours: 7:00 a.m. - 3:30 p.m., occasional on-call availability required 
  • Schedule: Five (5) days a week, Sunday through Thursday (days off Friday/Saturday) OR Tuesday through Saturday (days off Sunday/Monday) 
  • Holiday and weekend availability required 
  • This person’s territory will cover the In-N-Out Burger stores in the Denver area; Preferred if individual lives in close proximity to the North Denver area
  • Travel is required (25%)
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • Must have EPA certification and HVAC certification
  • A minimum of three (3) years’ experience in working in refrigeration, air conditioning repair, restaurant equipment repair
  • Strong electrical troubleshooting and repair experience
  • Knowledge of High Voltage AC Power (3 Phase)
  • "Soda Fountain" and trade school experience is a plus
  • Strong experience working as a Maintenance tech on commercial jobs
  • A valid CO Driver’s License (Company vehicle provided) 

About In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Project Carpenter
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time intermediate Project Carpenter/Tile Setter based in Baldwin Park, CA.  The Project Carpenter will cover the In-N-Out Burger stores throughout California.  The Carpenter will be responsible for the maintenance and construction of all In-N-Out Burger facilities and restaurants in the area of carpentry and tile setting.  

General Responsibilities
  • Strong Tile setting experience necessary; will install tiles on floors, walls and ceilings; install tiles in the restaurants and the bathrooms 
  • Perform basic Locksmith work and Tile application repair
  • Responsible for running projects and service calls, either alone, or with the assistance of other carpenters  
  • Spend time at the shop stocking inventory, maintaining phone contacts, and completing assigned paperwork
  • Remodel In-N-Out Burger dining rooms; knowledge of basic plumbing
  • Available to assist on emergency store calls for the In-N-Out Burger restaurants 
  • Maintain tool and supply inventory on truck
  • All tools and supplies provided by In-N-Out Burger

Work Schedule + Benefits 
  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Company provided tools 
  • Growth and development opportunities through continuous on-the-job training 
  • Pay Range is $27.75-$31.75 per hour (Beginner)
  • Pay Range is $36.00-$41.50 per hour (Intermediate)                   
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Schedule: 7 days on/7 days off; rotating days
  • Hours: Graveyard shift: 12:00 a.m. to 10:30 a.m.; overtime as needed
  • Travel: 40-50% of time, work will be spent out of town 
  • Company truck will be assigned (Must live within 45 miles of Baldwin Park Warehouse)
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance


Travel Schedule
  • Extensive travel is required - Carpenters work on all In-N-Out restaurants throughout the state of California, and sometimes out of state
  • Will require out-of-town travel for 1-2 weeks at a time, every month or every other month
  • Travel will require out of town hotel stays for 1 week, or more, at a time


Qualifications
  • 2-4+ years experience in Carpentry, Construction, or related fields 
  • 2-4+ years experience in Tile setting; Tile contractor experience a plus 
  • Extensive out of town and overnight travel: Ability to travel and be out of town for 1 week or more, at least every month or every other month
  • Strong customer service orientation  
  • Self-starter, independent worker, Pride and ownership of work
  • Strong attention to detail and good time management
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.
  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • A Valid California Driver's License with a clean driving record
  • Strong verbal and written English language communication skills



ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Human Resources Generalist - Employee Relations
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a Full-time Human Resources Generalist based in Lancaster, TX! The Human Resources Generalist will report to a Regional Human Resources Manager in the Human Resources department.

*This role is based full time in office.

General Responsibilities
  • Act as the primary point of contact for HR inquiries, managing a high volume of incoming phone calls. This includes engaging with Store Associates, Store Management, Support Center employees, and, occasionally, the General Public on a diverse range of HR topics.
  • Provide a front-line resource for Associate Relations matters, addressing complaints and allegations with professionalism and care.
  • Responsible for writing a high volume of supporting documents, including corrective actions, memorandums, physician assessments, etc.
  • Schedule and conduct investigation meetings and interviews with current Associates as requested.
  • Consistently follow up on all Associate issues and concerns as assigned.
  • Communicate Company policies, procedures, and guidelines effectively to all Associates.
  • Identify violations of Company policies, procedures, and guidelines swiftly and accurately.
  • Assist the HR Business Partner team by creating reports and collecting information to support investigations.
  • Support the HR Business Partner team and other department leaders with projects and assignments as required.

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Hourly Pay Range: $28.85 - $33.65 
  • The above represents the expected hourly range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Office Hours in Lancaster, TX: Monday - Friday, 8:00 a.m. -5:00 p.m.
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime
  • Excellent Benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSAs, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans, and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Communication, or a related field; HR certifications are a plus.
  • At least 2 years of experience in Human Resources, with broad exposure to various HR functions.
  • 2+ years of experience managing employee relations, conducting end-to end investigations, and providing guidance on employment-related matters.
  • Strong knowledge of state and federal labor laws and regulations, with demonstrated ability to apply this knowledge effectively across all levels of the organization.
  • Proven ability to work independently, exercise sound judgment, and make well-informed decisions.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, including presentation and interpersonal abilities.
  • Creative problem-solving skills with excellent organizational and time management capabilities.
  • Proficient in MS Office applications, with expertise in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
  • Bilingual in Spanish is a plus.

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Company Store Retail Clerk
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We currently have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Retail Clerk based in our Las Vegas In-N-Out Burger Company Store (4888 Dean Martin Dr., Las Vegas, NV 89103). The Retail Clerk will also be responsible for covering shifts at our retail store that is located at the Linq location (3545 Las Vegas Blvd., 89109). This person will be responsible for obtaining or receiving merchandise, accepting payments, and providing excellent customer service in the retail store. Position starts at $18.25/Hour.


General Responsibilities:

  • Greet and assist our walk-in customers in our Las Vegas Company Stores
  • Demonstrate a positive personality; strong commitment to helping In-N-Out customers and associates
  • Possess outstanding customer service skills
  • Obtain merchandise requested by customer, or receive merchandise selected by customer
  • Stock shelves, counters or tables with merchandise
  • Answer customer questions about merchandise and offer suggestions
  • Keep the store and showroom clean and orderly
  • Cashier and stock merchandise in the store
  • Place and verify orders to restock the storage room
  • Ensure inventory levels are correctly maintained and stored in the correct locations
  • Effectively communicate with your fellow team members; excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Work well with the Baldwin Park corporate warehouse regarding any issues with quantity or quality of merchandise
  • Maintain knowledge of current sales and promotions, policies regarding payment and exchanges, and recognize security risks and thefts
  • Assist with other projects as assigned by Merchandise Manager

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Schedule: Varied days: 7 days availability anywhere from 9:00 am to 11:30 pm
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Will be rotating between two store locations: Dean Martin and Linq Company Stores

Qualifications:

  • 1-2 years of customer’s service experience
  • Strong customer service skills required
  • Strong computer and typing skills; Excellent  knowledge of Microsoft Office software, including   Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong initiative; Ability to work independently and follow through on assignments with minimal direction and supervision
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with team
  • Valid Nevada Driver's License

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Chuck Receiver
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Chuck Receiver in our Chino, CA Meat Department.  This individual will be responsible for receiving and inspecting meat deliveries. Additionally, this individual will perform some work duties in our production area when needed.

General Responsibilities:

  • Ensures that meat deliveries are accurate and that the product meets In-N-Out and U.S.D.A. standards.  
  • Responsible for proper product stock and rotation. 
  • Reports all discrepancies in product quality or delivery performance to the Meat Department Manager.
  • Assisting in other meat department positions when necessary 

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Pay Range: $23.00-25.50 per hour            
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Hours: 5:00 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.; some overtime as needed
  • 5 days per week, rotating schedule and alternating days off
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance


Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or GED
  • A minimum of one (1) year experience working in a meat facility, food processing plant, or similar warehouse experience 
  • Experience with food line work; repetitive line work
  • Ability to move freely in and around obstacles common in the meat production room 

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs. 
  • Cold working conditions - Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in cold temperatures
  • Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
Qualifications:
High school diploma or GED
A minimum of one (1) year experience working in a meat facility, food processing plant, or similar warehouse experience
Experience with food line work; repetitive line work
Ability to move freely in and around obstacles common in the meat production room
Physical Demands/Requirements:
Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.
Cold working conditions - Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in cold temperatures
Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.
In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Head of Tax and Treasury
description_html:
Come Join Our Family!
We are excited to offer an exceptional full-time opportunity for a Head of Treasury & Tax based in our Irvine, CA office. Reporting to the Director of Accounting & Controller, this position is responsible for overseeing the cash management and tax compliance functions at In-N-Out Burger. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and reviewing policies and procedures for treasury and tax, managing relationships with banking partners, overseeing cash forecasts, and overseeing the preparation of financial information to support quarterly and annual tax filings, and GAAP financial statement reporting. In this role, you will supervise the leaders on our treasury operations team and our tax team.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Lead cash management and forecasting, incorporating best practices and automation to improve treasury operations, and cash reporting and forecasting accuracy.
  • Build and maintain strong relationships with external stakeholders, including banks, and other financial service providers.
  • Manage credit card relationships, working with processors and card networks.
  • Lead, mentor, and develop the Treasury Operations Team and the Tax Team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
  • Oversee the Tax department’s compliance with federal, state, and local tax regulations, collaborating with external Big 4 tax firm to implement tax initiatives.
  • Review bank analysis statements to identify opportunities for optimizing fees.
  • Monitor short-term cash investment opportunities and execute investment strategies aligned with company goals.
  • Identify and implement tax optimization strategies in support of company growth and new business initiatives.
  • Review quarterly and annual tax and investment disclosures in financial statement reports, in accordance with GAAP.
  • Lead RFP process for banking and credit card services.
  • Ensure daily wires and ACH transactions for multiple bank structures are completed securely and efficiently.
  • Oversee ERP enhancements related to cash management and tax software, driving improvements in ERP modules.
  • Monitor and ensure compliance with credit facility covenants.
  • Ensure the accurate and timely completion of KYC (Know Your Customer) requirements.

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Pay Range is $171,000-$228,000* annualized salary, plus bonus. *Represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. This role is eligible to participate in the Company Bonus program. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Department needs will call for occasional overtime
  • Onsite, in office hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Full-time position, Exempt
 

Qualifications:
  • BA/BS in Accounting or Tax; MS in Tax or MBA with an emphasis in Accounting/Tax.
  • 15+ years of experience leading a treasury or tax team with a proven track record of strong leadership and people management skills.
  • CTP (Certified Treasury Professional), or CPA (Certified Public Accountant), required.
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and skilled in effective collaboration and communication.
  • Strong learning ability with intermediate Excel proficiency.
  • Experience with ERP software, Oracle experience preferred.
  • Deep working knowledge of tax regulations and practices.
  • Prior experience managing banking relationships and credit card processor relationships, including leading RFPs for banking and credit card services.
  • Hands-on experience across tax, treasury, cash management, and bank management functions.
  • Intermediate/Advanced MS Office skills, particularly in Excel.


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.
Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

title: Plumber
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Plumber to service the In-N-Out Burger stores in Texas. The Plumber is based out of the Lancaster, TX warehouse, and will be responsible for troubleshooting, servicing, and repairing Plumber-related issues at the In-N-Out Burger restaurants throughout Texas, Colorado, and Tennessee.

General Responsibilities

• Install, maintain, and repair plumbing systems and fixtures for In-N-Out Burger restaurants throughout the company

• Perform sewer repairs

• Perform gas and water line repairs

• Locate and repair issues with water supply lines, such as leaks, etc.

• Troubleshoot, service, and complete repairs to plumbing systems of current restaurants

• Repair or replace broken drainage lines, clogged drains, faucets, etc.

• Use augers, snakes, cameras, remodels and new system installations

• Maintain the cleanliness of their work area

Work Schedule + Benefits

• Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt

• 4 nights per week, 10-hour days

• Hours: Graveyard shift: 12:00 a.m. to 10:30 a.m.; overtime as needed

• Weekend and holiday availability required

• Travel: 40-50% of the time Plumbers will be out of town or out of state; Travel required to the states where In-N-Out Burger operates including Texas, Colorado, and Tennessee

• Excellent full-time Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) retirement Plan

Qualifications

  • Plumbing repair and remodel experience preferred.
  • Professional plumbing experience in residential or commercial service and repair preferred.
  • Solid understanding of water distribution and disposal systems in commercial, industrial, or restaurant buildings preferred.
  • Extensive travel schedule – must be able to travel out of town/out of state for up to 8 days at a time
  • A Valid Driver's License
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.
  • Good physical condition and strength with the ability to work in awkward spaces
  • Familiarity with Uniform Plumbing Codes
  • Strong customer service orientation; Friendly
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills; Be able to interact with all levels of management and outside organizations to represent the company in a positive and professional manner

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Development & Fundraising Manager
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! The Community Engagement and Fundraising team has an excellent opportunity for a Development & Fundraising Manager based at our Irvine, CA* office.

The Development & Fundraising Manager plays a pivotal role in leading donor development and fundraising efforts for the In-N-Out Burger and Slave 2 Nothing Foundations. Reporting to the Community Engagement Department Head, this position oversees the team responsible for managing donation activities and crafting both short- and long-term fundraising strategies that align with the foundations' vision and mission.

Collaboration is at the heart of this role, requiring close partnerships across multiple functions within the organization. By fostering a deep understanding of donor behavior, both internally and externally, this role ensures the foundations’ goals are met. Strategic partnerships with both foundations will be key to driving success, increasing awareness of our causes, and securing critical funding to support our mission.

*This role is full-time, in-office only

Responsibilities
  • Develop and execute a comprehensive fundraising strategy aimed at expanding and diversifying the donor base. Focus on increasing support from individual donors (customers, community members, and major gifts) and institutional partners (vendors and corporate donors).
  • Identify new donor opportunities through thorough research and cultivate relationships by soliciting funding in innovative and creative ways.
  • Provide clear leadership, direction, and oversight to the fundraising team. Mentor and support team members in their professional growth, ensuring alignment with organizational goals.
  • Partner with INOBF and S2N Foundation Managers to establish immediate and long-term fundraising goals that align with the strategic vision of the organization.
  • Oversee the management of donor records with a focus on leveraging tools like Salesforce Marketing Cloud to design and execute effective fundraising campaigns.
  • Cultivate strong working relationships within the organization and externally with vendors, nonprofit organizations, foundations, and community partners, serving as a representative of the Foundations and Community Engagement Department.
  • Develop, implement, and manage company-wide giving opportunities that engage employees, corporate partners, and the broader community.
  • Represent In-N-Out Burger at fundraising events, speaking engagements, and in meetings with businesses, nonprofits, foundations, grant-makers, and community leaders, ensuring a professional and impactful presence.

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt
  • Salary Range: $105,000 - $142,500
  • The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors. This role is also eligible to participate in the company bonus program. 
  • Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8AM - 5 PM 
  • Department needs may call for occasional evenings and weekends as needed for fundraising events. 
  • Travel time: It is anticipated that 10-20% of the work time will be spent in the field. 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans, and Pet Insurance.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Fundraising, Communications, Administration, or a related field required. A Master’s degree in Business or a related field is preferred.
  • Minimum of 5 years of proven success in corporate giving, corporate fundraising, or corporate partnership development, with a focus on cultivating and maintaining donor relationships.
  • At least 5 years in a supervisory or leadership role, with demonstrated ability to develop and mentor fundraising teams.
  • Experience building and executing strategic fundraising plans to diversify and expand donor bases across individual and institutional channels.
  • Extensive knowledge of corporate giving strategies, including developing and managing company-wide giving opportunities and corporate donor programs.
  • Proven ability to identify new donors, conduct research on fundraising opportunities, and solicit funding through innovative approaches.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, including public speaking and the ability to engage corporate and community audiences.
  • Strong strategic thinking and relationship-building skills to develop effective partnerships within and outside the organization.
  • Demonstrated ability to direct and oversee donor database management, including building and managing campaigns through tools like Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and proficient in time management, analytics, and decision-making.
  • Advanced experience with fundraising, CSR, donor database, and payment processing systems, including Salesforce.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and project management tools like Asana.

Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. 

In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

ABOUT the Community Engagement Department
The In-N-Out Burger Foundation was established in 1995 with the goal of raising funds to assist abused and neglected children in the communities where we live and do business.  

In 2016, the Slave 2 Nothing Foundation was established to educate and assist in solutions to eliminate human trafficking as well as focus on those needing treatment, rehabilitation and prevention from drug/alcohol abuse. Our Fundraising Team supports both foundations with small and large scaled fundraising efforts as well as collaborating with Community Impact on volunteer opportunities for our In-N-Out Burger Associates and their families.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Fundraising, Communications, Administration, or a related field required. A Master’s degree in Business or a related field is preferred.
Minimum of 5 years of proven success in corporate giving, corporate fundraising, or corporate partnership development, with a focus on cultivating and maintaining donor relationships.
At least 5 years in a supervisory or leadership role, with demonstrated ability to develop and mentor fundraising teams.
Experience building and executing strategic fundraising plans to diversify and expand donor bases across individual and institutional channels.
Extensive knowledge of corporate giving strategies, including developing and managing company-wide giving opportunities and corporate donor programs.
Proven ability to identify new donors, conduct research on fundraising opportunities, and solicit funding through innovative approaches.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, including public speaking and the ability to engage corporate and community audiences.
Strong strategic thinking and relationship-building skills to develop effective partnerships within and outside the organization.
Demonstrated ability to direct and oversee donor database management, including building and managing campaigns through tools like Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
Highly organized, detail-oriented, and proficient in time management, analytics, and decision-making.
Advanced experience with fundraising, CSR, donor database, and payment processing systems, including Salesforce.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and project management tools like Asana.
Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.
Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho.
In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.
ABOUT the Community Engagement Department
The In-N-Out Burger Foundation was established in 1995 with the goal of raising funds to assist abused and neglected children in the communities where we live and do business.
In 2016, the Slave 2 Nothing Foundation was established to educate and assist in solutions to eliminate human trafficking as well as focus on those needing treatment, rehabilitation and prevention from drug/alcohol abuse. Our Fundraising Team supports both foundations with small and large scaled fundraising efforts as well as collaborating with Community Impact on volunteer opportunities for our In-N-Out Burger Associates and their families.
In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Executive Events Specialist
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

 

We have an excellent opportunity based in our Irvine, CA office, for a highly motivated Executive Events Specialist.  This position will provide support for the Executive Events Team in coordinating In-N-Out Burger’s Owner and Family events, including preparation, organization, and support from the office and onsite, as needed.  This individual will collaborate closely with the Executive Events Team throughout the event organization process of various programs such as Corporate, Personal, Incentive and Philanthropic events.

The role requires strong organization skills, attention to detail, self-motivation, and the ability to remain calm under pressure while delivering a concierge level of customer service. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills in this role are crucial for building relationships with our teams’ customers, vendors, team members, and internal partners. The Executive Event Coordinator will handle confidential information, requiring discretion and confidentiality. Adaptability and a proactive approach to problem-solving are essential for handling the dynamic nature of events within the Executive Events Team.

*This position is 100% in office and will be based in Irvine, CA.

 

General Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for complex administrative tasks to help support the Executive Event Planners – including managing on-site supplies and ordering intake, hotel room blocks management, event shadowing, meeting document preparation, Asana organization, and design/collateral needs.
  • Assist with coordination of various Event needs (event organization, communication, calendaring, ordering and shipping materials, coordination and communication with internal and external partners, invoice processing & facilitating payment, attendee communication and management of supplies for the team: snacks, water, etc.)
  • On-site support and concierge level service to Family/VIPs
  • Assist Planners with Event research and preparation
  • Assist Executive Events Manager & Team in creating presentation material for VIP Bi-Weekly Meetings, Department Meetings, etc.
  • Handle & manage multiple expense reports reconciling multiple credit card accounts and charges
  • Implement various process improvements for the team


Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Salaried, Exempt
  • Salary Range is $63,450 - $80,000
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition.  Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Office Hours: Mon-Fri, 8:00 am-5:00 pm with occasional (15%-20%)  overnight travel and weekend travel
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Requirements:

  • High school diploma or equivalent required
  • Bachelor’s degree preferred
  • 4+ years of administrative support or event coordination preferred
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office 365 (Outlook, Teams, Powerpoint, Word, Excel)
  • Proficiency with Asana and Concur preferred
  • Strong organizational skills, team orientation, and understanding of the Event industry.

Work Location Details 

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948. Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger. 


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

 

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Meat Dept. Maintenance Tech I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Meat Department Maintenance Technician in our Lancaster, TX Meat Warehouse.  The Maintenance Technician will be responsible for the preventative maintenance and repairs of machinery in the Meat department for In-N-Out Burger. Currently we have an opening on second shift with a starting pay range of $27.92/HR- $36.00/HR DOE. 

General Responsibilities:

  • Ability to troubleshoot electrical circuits 
  • Complete all assigned work orders including preventative maintenance in a timely manner
  • Responsible for proactively evaluating and maintaining mechanical systems in the Meat department
  • Responsible for maintaining the upkeep and cleanliness of all mechanical rooms
  • Creating work orders for related repairs needed for equipment
  • Willingness to receive training on critical systems such as Ammonia Refrigeration, VFD’s, Metal Detectors, Servo Drives etc.

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Starting Pay Range: $27.92/HR- $36.00/HR per hour DOE
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Schedule: Second Shift (1:00PM- 9:30PM)
  • Work Days: Monday- Friday
  • Some overtime as needed
  • 5 days per week 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications:

  • Perform job duties with a heighten level of detail 
  • Knowledge of basic electrical 
  • Basic mechanical knowledge (plumbing) 
  • Basic Industrial and Commercial Construction safety practices
  • Experience with power tools (drill press, sanders, powered cutting tools, various portable drills
  • Ability to read Electrical schematics
Ability to interpret mechanical drawings

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs. 
  • Cold working conditions - Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit; Temperature fluctuations in the warehouse  
  • Ability to move freely in and around obstacles common in the meat production room 

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Meat Dept. Maintenance Tech II
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Meat Department Maintenance Technician II in our Lathrop, CA warehouse.  The Maintenance Technician will be responsible for performing maintenance tasks in the areas of HVAC, Ammonia Refrigeration, PLC Trouble Shooting, Electrical repairs and installations, VFD’s, Painting, Pluming, Welding, and Fabrication. The ideal candidate will be able to work autonomously and maintain our building and equipment in the best possible condition.

General Responsibilities

  • Perform preventative maintenance of electrical, hydraulic, plumbing and mechanical systems.
  • Assist in the testing/repairing of refrigeration systems.
  • Maintain heating and cooling systems to IN-N-OUT Standards.
  • Inspect alarm systems (fire, NH3 ammonia) and schedule repairs.
  • Perform repairs on building doors, door locks, windows etc.
  • Perform general upkeep on tasks assigned by the Work Order System or Supervisor.

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Pay Range is $33.56-$38.50 per hour 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Hours: 5:30am to 2:30pm (willing to be flexible)
  • Some overtime as needed
  • 5 days per week, rotating schedule and alternating days off
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) Plan

Job Requirements:

Qualifications

  • Five (5) years minimum experience as an “A” Maintenance Mechanic within a meat-processing environment.
  • Basic understanding of electrical, hydraulic, mechanical and other systems.
  • Knowledge of general maintenance processes and methods.
  • HVAC refrigeration experience a plus; Ammonia refrigeration a plus.
  • Ability to work independently and with others and perform duties with minimum supervision.
  • Ability to understand occupational hazards and utilize standard safety practices.
  • Ability to complete all assigned work including preventative maintenance and work orders in a timely manner.

Physical Demands/Requirements

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.
  • Cold/Hot working conditions - Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 24 degrees Fahrenheit and as high as 100 degrees Fahrenheit; Temperature fluctuations in the warehouse. 
  • Ability to move freely in and around obstacles common in the meat production room.

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Materials Planner I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Materials Planner I currently based in our Chino, CA warehouse*.  The Materials Planner will work in the Purchasing department and reports directly to the Materials Planning Manager.  The Purchasing department is responsible for ensuring continuity of supply for all outbound goods/raw materials for assigned Warehouses and Stores, while maintaining a high-level of service that translates to a positive customer experience.    

*This position is full-time, in-office/in-warehouse only

General Responsibilities

  • Conduct daily Store needs assessment by generating reports to confirm accuracy of Store orders; make adjustments to orders as needed
  • Generate detailed reports using Excel
  • Helps with Materials planning using Excel to forecast, track data, create reports, etc.
  • Manages the outbound and inbound orders for all materials and goods in the stores
  • Answer phone calls from Stores with ad-hoc requests; update Store orders as necessary 
  • Build and monitor levels across all distribution centers and ensure daily continuity of supply 
  • Manage inventory levels across designated Warehouse facilities; ensure assigned Warehouses do not run out of key items/raw materials 
  • Support PO to invoice matching efforts and resolve invoice payment issues 

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Pay Range is $28.79-$31.00 per hour
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Shift Hours:

     - SUN-THUR, 7:00 am – 3:30 pm.  Days off are Friday/Saturday

Or

     - TUE-SAT, 7:00 am – 3:30 pm.  Days off are Sunday/Monday

  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime; some holiday availability required 
  • Location: Chino, CA warehouse
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

INO associate Qualifications

  • In-N-Out Burger Store experience - Minimum of 2 years in the stores (store knowledge is preferred for this role)
  • Store experience: Level 5 or above preferred
  • Support experience – Minimum of 1 year in Support with previous Store experience 

Additional Qualifications 

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Supply Chain Management, Inventory Control, Material Planning, Purchasing, or related field, is strongly preferred
  • Advance knowledge of Excel – Must be able to build and apply advanced formulas, Use the Formula tab and Functions library, have strong working knowledge of Charts, be able to troubleshoot in Excel, etc.  
  • Materials Requirements Planning (MRP) Management & Procurement experience
  • Forecasting and Ordering /Ordering products for the Warehouse 
  • Basic knowledge of High Jump is highly desirable 
  • 2+ years of Warehouse experience is preferable  

Physical Demands/Requirements

  • Ability to lift up to 25 lbs. 
  • Warehouse environment - Frequent standing, walking, siting, reaching, carrying, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Procurement Manager
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a Procurement Manager based in our Chino, CA warehouse. The Procurement Manager reports to the Department Head – Procurement and proactively manages and supports the raw material supply base to meet/exceed In-N-Out Burger's service, quality, cost, inventory, growth, and innovation requirements.  This role is also responsible for strategic sourcing, supply risk mitigation, supplier relationship management, and cost management.  

General Responsibilities

  • Partner with key functional leaders and stakeholders to deliver best-in-class service, quality, cost, and inventory performance.  
  • Conduct business reviews with key stakeholders to monitor progress against key goals/priorities, identify issues and opportunities, and understand category trends.
  • Support the development and implementation of supply risk mitigation strategies for key raw materials; lead complex cross-functional assessments to identify and prioritize supply risk mitigation activities.  
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to qualify new suppliers and raw materials to reduce supply risk; lead and support large-scale bid events and negotiations with suppliers.
  • Develop and implement category strategies that deliver against overall requirements at the best value; partner with cross-functional teams to expand supplier network (i.e. identify potential suppliers, assess capability, strengthen supply chain, negotiate pricing, execute contracts, etc.)
  • Develop and foster highly engaged supplier and 3rd party partners that provide a competitive advantage; conduct supplier segmentation assessment (i.e. Strategic, Collaborative, and Transactional) and develop strategies to drive improved value with suppliers in each segment.
  • Partner with key stakeholders to identify, assess, prioritize, and execute cost reduction initiatives.  
  • Leverage market/commodity insights, inflation mitigation techniques, escalation/de-escalation clauses, etc. to forecast costs and secure market competitive pricing; provide regular updates on cost inflation by category.
  • Support people planning activities including talent/capability assessments, succession planning, etc.  
  • Coach and mentor team members to promote learning/growth and support career goals including overseeing new employee onboarding; foster and promote a positive work environment where employees are deeply engaged and committed.
  • Generate and monitor performance reports that track and analyze supplier performance metrics on a regular cadence (i.e. monthly, quarterly, etc.); collaborate cross-functionally to identify improvement opportunities.  

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Exempt
  • Hours: 8:00am – 5:00pm, Monday through Friday
  • Overtime as necessary
  • Occasional travel for visits to suppliers and In-N-Out Burger Warehouses, which may include nights & weekends (10-15% of the time) 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Pay Range is $140,000 - $180,000 annually 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Job Requirements

  • A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in a field such as Supply Chain Management, Finance or related, required 
  • 10+ years' experience in Procurement and/or Supply Chain role, preferably in the restaurant industry is required
  • 5+ years' experience with strategic sourcing, negotiations, contracts, etc.; required
  • 5+ years' experience in food manufacturing/restaurant industry; preferred 
  • Previous experience with purchasing fresh produce and dry goods (i.e. paper products, plastics, janitorial supplies, etc.); preferred
  • One or more of the following certifications is preferred:  Procurement or Purchasing Professional, Supply Chain Professional, Lean or Six Sigma 
  • Proficient in MS Office, with intermediate skills in Word, PowerPoint, and Excel is required    
  • Proven ability to network and build relationships; ability to interact with all levels of management 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Ability to take initiative and be a highly motivated self-starter
  • Must be able to work on multiple projects simultaneously while remaining organized, efficient and flexible 
  • Experience in leading a team, providing a path for career development, and the desire and ability to provide direct reports with training and tools to grow and succeed 
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality while exercising discretion and good judgment 
  • Valid California Driver's License required
  • Willingness to travel as needed (10-15%)
  • Ability to lift up to 25 pounds
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Journeyman Painter
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Painter based out of our Lancaster, TX facility. This position will be responsible for the prep and painting of In-N-Out Burger restaurant locations and other company facilities throughout Texas.

General Responsibilities:

  • Paint the interior and exterior of In-N-Out Burger restaurants and other company facilities
  • Use brush and roller, airless, HVLP, and a variety of paint products
  • Make on-site preparations such as building scaffolding, covering fixtures, etc.
  • Prepare walls and other surfaces for painting by scraping, using sandpaper, removing old paint, etc.
  • Operating, maintaining and cleaning all equipment
  • Completing necessary paperwork
  • Completion of work orders and projects in a timely manner
  • Pre-painting preparation including supply estimation, scraping, patching, sanding and clean up
  • Painting of restaurants and other company facilities
  • Follow all health and safety precautions

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Temporary Full-time position, Hourly, Non-Exempt - This position can lead to a permanent position with in 90days
  • Pay Range is $26.50-$30.50 per hour (Journeyman Painter)       
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • 4 nights per week, 10-hour shifts  
  • Work Days: Tuesday–Friday  --  mostly no weekends! On-Call availability required
  • Hours: Graveyard shift: 12:00 a.m. to 10:30 a.m.
  • Department needs will call for occasional overtime
  • Warehouse location: Lancaster, TX.  Ideally the candidate would live within 40 miles of the Lathrop warehouse
  • Travel: Driving is required throughout Texas market
  • Company van and Painting tools will be provided
  • Travel: 45% travel out of town and out of state, including overnight hotel stays for up to a week or more
  • In-N-Out Burger offers the following benefits to Temporary Associates:  401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan 
    • Eligibility criteria must be met for 401k participation. 
  • Permanent Associate Benefits: Excellent full-time Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) retirement Plan

Qualifications

  • Minimum of two (2) years experience as a Painter
  • Excellent knowledge of painting material and how to select, mix and apply them
  • Ability to use appropriate tools (paint brushes, caulking guns, etc.)
  • Familiarity with OSHA general safety practices for the painting industry preferred
  • In-N-Out Burger store experience (preferred, but not required); Must be in good standing
  • Great attention to detail
  • Represent the company in a positive and professional manner
  • Physical requirements: Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.
  • Valid Texas Driver's License
  • High school diploma or GED; successful completion of a Painting apprenticeship

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.
